46 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
10 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Non recommandé
2.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 mars 2020
Not nearly as good as Gearbox's fist expansion to Valve's Half-Life (Opposing Force). For many reasons. First of all, it was released in 2001. Three years after the original game and two years after the Opposing Force. And, even though I was completely in love with Half-Life back in the days, I can't say I cared much at that point. Three years of Half-Life was more than enough.

The funniest thing, though, I always wanted to play as one of those security officers back then. They may look kind of silly for modern kids, but back in the days? Those looked totally cool. Blue uniform, bulletproof vests... those were awesome. So, even though I felt like I had enough, I still bought this expansion (still have my first physical copy on me, even though Steam offers us more convenient digital version now). I mean, sure, in 2001 Half-Life was an old news. 2001 brought us games like Aliens Versus Predator 2, Clive Barker's Undying, HALO: Combat Evolved, Return to Castle Wolfenstein, TRIBES 2, AquaNox and many others, so, looking back at Half-Life felt a lot like a waste of time, but... dang, I just wanted that blue uniform in my life.

Unfortunately, like I've already said, Blue Shift turned out to be a disappointment. And not only because technically, it was a 1998 game released in 2001 (let's not forget that technology used to evolve way faster than it does today and three years used to be a huge period of time). Half-Life looked way too good for its time to had a chance years later. And even though it was unable to look competitive enough in 2001, it was still possible to forget about AVP2 for a moment and make yourself to look back at Half-Life for a bit more. The problem was – Gearbox guys were unable to provide us with anything new. Literally, anything.

When Opposing Force came out, it offered tons of new content. A lot of interesting new weapons, night vision, ropes, Barnacle as a Zelda-like hookshot, the ability to give orders to the friendly soldiers... It was a whole new experience. Blue Shift? It has nothing like that. Everything that was added in previous expansion was completely removed (literally, everything) and... nothing new was added. Blue Shift has no new weapons, Blue Shift has no new features and even the training here is exactly the same with the original Half-Life. Heck, even the story is a huge disappointment. Sure, you'll still see some old events from the new point of view (our new hero, Barney Calhoun is that security officer that you can see near the closed door at the very beginning of the original game), but... that's pretty much it. Gearbox were unable to come out with anything interesting for Calhoun. And as the result, this expansion feels both lacking and forced. Like something that was made “just because”, with no special idea or reason.

The only difference in gameplay here is that Barney doesn't have any power armor. But guess what? It only makes the game worse. Since you can't use the armor chargers anymore, since your only way to get some armor is to find the new vest and since there's less weapon in this game than in both previous titles, we ended up having way (WAY) less enemies and no final boss whatsoever. Yeah... it's that disappointing. So disappointing that we can't even get a proper boss. Even the story is anticlimactic. Blue Shift is a game about how security officer and a couple of scientists tried to escape... and succeed. No G-Man intervention, no badass monster, no big revelation, nothing like that. Boring, boring, boring stuff.

And guess what? Bad stuff doesn't even end here. For example, Blue Shift doesn't offer enough outdoor experience (no helicopters, no bombing, no dam...), most of the time it'll be all about sewers and tunnels (which all look the same), while alien world parts are especially annoying here. Can't say that level design is a complete disaster, but there's something to ruin even that. The thing is, Blue Shift comes with way too much scripted stuff and interactions with the NPCs are way too painful. How should I put it... let's just say that ol' man Romero is not the only one who can make you his ♥♥♥♥♥. Clearly, Gearbox played DAIKATANA. The question is... who in the right mind would think that it'll be a good idea to do the same thing after playing DAIKATANA?!

Well, Gearbox did. And they ended up with pretty much the same exact set of problems. Half-broken scripts, weird bugs and that exact epic NPC / doors fiasco. Sure, Blue Shift doesn't feel nearly as bad as early versions of DAIKATANA, but you can totally expect the important NPC saying something like “we're close!” and then starting to run in a totally opposite direction with an incredible speed.

Sure, Blue Shift is still a Half-Life game. And if you're a die-hard fan of the original game, you still have a chance to enjoy your time here. At least up to a certain degree. But, let's be honest, it's far from being good. It's forced, it's boring, it doesn't offer any new features, while failing to provide even the most basic things (like boss battles), there's almost no story, there's too much scripted stuff, DAIKATANA-like content is annoying, etc, etc, etc. Blue Shift was the last attempt to make more money from Half-Life, but instead of being blast from the past, it ended up being a cold dumpling. And, let me quote one of my most favorite fantasy writers out there, “there's nothing as sad as a cold dumpling”.
 
Letande
3,944 produits enregistrés
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Évaluation publiée le 1 janvier 2022
Here you will see why I love Half-Life: Blue Shift, but in my review you will read about why I gave it a negative review due to some problems.

I love Half-Life: Blue Shift I love the story behind Barney Callhoun. I love the story from the views of a security guard at Black Mesa and that take.

Now I remember back in 2005 when I first played Half-Life: Blue Shift it had DirectX 8 support and now with VALVe pushing Linux support and removing DirectX 8 from the Gold Source engine video games adding OpenGL support to the Gold Source engine video games I keep getting OpenGL errors every now and then and some freezing issues, which I do not remember ever happening with DirectX 8.

Here is a screenshot of one of the few OpenGL errors I experience here and there. Followed by freezing of the video games that use OpenGL, before crashing.

https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/887417416764768257/926930307003850792/OpenGL_errors_on_video_games_that_use_OpenGL_on_Windows.png

VALVe please add DirectX 8 support or at least a more up to date version of DirectX 9 support which supports 64-bit, which is DirectX 9.0C I believe?

Save game bug again encountered.

Otherwise I cannot give Half-Life: Blue a positive review due to these technical issues, which I cannot seem to fix even if I reinstall Windows or Half-Life: Blue Shift.

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
3.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 décembre 2017
Описание:
Шутер от первого лица позволяющий посмотреть на происходящие события в "Half-Life" глазами другого персонажа. Мы играем за охранника Барни, который только заступив на смену получает задание проверить неисправность устройств. Тут-же мы видим в камеру как Фримен отправляется в лабораторию, в другой камере тащат большой кристалл. Мы ведь уже знаем что будет дальше... Взрывы, инопланетяне, десантники... Надо выбираться с базы! Чем мы собственно говоря и займемся.

Плюсы:
¥ Полностью новое обучение разработанное для охраны комплекса.
¥ Отличный сюжет дополняющий наши знания о вселенной "Half-Life".
¥ Упор в дополнении сделан на головоломки и большую часть игры мы будем думать как включить вентиль или куда тащить бочку.

Минусы:
¥ Главная игра всего стима, спустя почти двадцать лет после выпуска так и не обзавелась ачивками, руссификатором и мастерской в стиме.
¥ Очень короткая продолжительность игры. Вся игра на сложном режиме проходится за 4 часа.
¥ Полностью мертвый мультиплеер и полное отсутствие модов. Даже плохих модов под BS нету. Есть парочка любительских и только...
¥ Нет никакого нового оружия да и из старого нам встречается хорошо если половина.
¥ Очень мало врагов встречается в игре. Вернее врагов много, но они не блещут разнообразием. Нет черных оперативников, зато есть очень много вартигонов и хедкрабов.

Итог:
Худший аддон для HL, но в то же время он хорош сам по себе. Если в OF нам представили всю игру как шутер, то тут это больше головоломка. Сюжет раскрывается с новых сторон, да и сам персонаж перекочевал в HL2. В целом рекомендую, но высокого балла аддон никогда не заслуживал.

Оценка: 7/10

Послесловие:
Если вам понравился этот обзор добро пожаловать в группу
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/uojer - тут вы сможете увидеть рекомендованные мною игры, другие обзоры, а также просто пообщаться в хорошей компании.
 
Creative
8,418 produits enregistrés

Its a decent expansion to the original Half Life.

Compared to the main game or to Opposing Force, it is a bit underwhelming. But, if you love Half Life, then you will still find a good bit of enjoyment in this, like I did.

Its also interesting to see how Barney escaped Black Mesa, as well!

Évaluation publiée le 27 janvier 2023
半个学期的信息技术课通关了盗版 打折了来补个票
个人认为蓝色行动未必比针锋相对差
武器和敌人的类型单调，剧情短，时间跨度小，boss战格局小，然而蓝色行动给我的感觉却是整个半条命1系列里感官最好的。虽然流程短，但是没有一些很冗长无聊的剧情。半条命1诚然经典，但是如“地面激战”等些环节真的有过长的问题，让人很乏味，蓝色行动的游戏时长对我而言刚刚好；从整个游戏的氛围来看，就是在诠释啥叫“保安”——尽最大的努力保护设施和科研人员。缺少武器？巴尼能拿到那些武器才奇怪了呢，他就是一保安，有什么权限接触机密等级的东西？有什么资格进入核心地带？对吧。boss战格局小？在那个环境下。正常人谁会期待一场大的“boss战”呢？马上杀过来的陆战队员对于一个保安来说，威胁还不够大？罗森博格说的话得听完，不然呢？你是干啥的？对吧。所以玩蓝色行动的时候，部分人提到的缺点确确实实都是实实在在的“不好玩”，但是蓝色行动的“在危机中求生”的感觉和黑山灾难气氛的营造，以及主角行为和身份的贴合程度（点名批评某上蹿下跳的博士）给我感觉是三部中最好的，主角就是保安，所以把自己代入成保安就会收获不一样的体验
 
thisisxu
0

Recommandé
3.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 février 2016
Однажды, когда я был еще слишком мелким и неопытным, игры задевали меня тем, чего по прошествии многих лет я уже не могу найти. И когда друг принес мне диск со странным названием "Голубой сдвиг" (вот же бред для непосвященного, правда? Да и для посвященного тоже, если подумать...), я боялся всего и вся. Зомби с хедкрабами на головах, сами хедкрабы, глубокие пропасти, темнота, царившая в углах... и вортигонты. Почему-то я боялся их больше всего.

Сейчас, перепройдя ее во второй раз - чего я не сделал, будучи 8-9-летним мальцом - я понял, что детское воображение стоит выше по ощущениям, чем взрослое. Не могу сказать, что игра хороша или плоха - у всех по разному, но мне она нравится и поныне. И, так как это была первая игра из серии Полураспада, которую я распробовал, для меня она - эталон.

З.Ы. А то, как тащили по полу тело бесчувственного Гордона - самое лучшее воспоминание об игре)

Куратор

Ставьте лайк, подписывайтесь на кураторскую страничку и ищите новое в играх!)

I can recommend to half life fans, when it is on sale. It was nice, and there were some great moments in this game. There were some really nice areas and puzzles, plus you get to see Gordon Freeman. Criticism: it is short. I completed it in 2.6 hours, which pales in opposing force's 9 hours. The ending was a bit abrupt and a little underwhelming, I wish it would have some final challenge or something goes wrong or something. Sometimes I felt slightly that I needed to wait until something was complete. There are no special weapons. All in all I enjoyed it.

6.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 juin 2022
These games are all iconic and in the 20 years old range by now, you're probably fine, but story spoilers for this, base Half-Life 1, and Half-Life 2 below. Only very light spoilers for that last one.

-----------------------------

I never quite got the vibe from HL2 Barney that he'd been to Xen before. Maybe he was always just too focused on the Resistance movement at hand to play catch-up, maybe it's a consequence of the fact that Valve didn't really have the expansions in mind when making HL2. Either way, for one reason or another I always perceived a certain comparative mundanity in HL2 Barney. That is to say, I always thought he was just some dude who happened to fight his way out of Black Mesa competently enough to escape, whereas Gordon Freeman has his legendary reputation for making the HECU and border world his b-words. But to my surprise, Calhoun is sent by Rosenberg into Xen for a quick teleport rerouter patch.

Black Mesa had been sending employees to Xen to scout it out and milk it for all it was worth already (the environmental storytelling of base HL1 covered this) but it still strikes me as odd to find out that low level hallway guard Barney, who probably didn't get glimpses of the scientists' experiments a lot and "still [has] nightmares about that cat", had to go inter-dimensional and fight a few Controllers just to meet continuity status quo. I dunno. Maybe the Combine gave Calhoun plenty reason to forget about his escape from the incident. Maybe having experienced a fluctuating teleport himself is the real reason he got so concerned during Gordon's. Or maybe this is all just me caring too much about overthinking the narrative of a video game series and its relation to externally developed supplementary material.

Oh, right, this was a video game, I should review that part. It's alright. If you just want a little more Half-Life 1, this sure is about 3 hours' worth of it. I'm looking forward to seeing HECU Collective's remake of it pan out; I find Black Mesa Source and all things related to it have delivered splendidly on the promise they showed so far--stuff's been worth the weight, so to speak.
 
AndrewNebz

11.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 décembre 2014
Contrairement aux trois-quarts des gens, je n’ai pas joué à Half-Life à sa sortie en 98. Je l’ai fini pour la première fois la semaine dernière. C’est un jeu qui a très bien vieilli mais je ne pense pas que ça soit le chef d’oeuvre indépassable du FPS (apparemment au contraire des trois quarts des gens qui écrivent les critiques).

J’ai enchaîné avec Blue Shift tout de suite après et je dois dire que j’ai beaucoup aimé, peut-être même plus qu’Half-Life. Le problème d’Half-Life c’est que pour les standards d’aujourd’hui, c’est un jeu long, très long. Bien sûr, les environnements sont variés et les niveaux très inventifs, mais il arrive qu’on s'ennuie.

Blue Shift est une version « light «  d’Half-Life. Il y en a pour environ 4-5h de jeu mais les niveaux s’enchaînent très rapidement sans qu’on ait le temps de s’ennuyer. Les combats sont amusants, les puzzles pas (trop) prise de tête.

Alors bien sûr il y a des gens pour critiquer l’absence de nouvelles armes, l’absence de nouveaux monstres ou bien et je cite « le pack de textures HD qui dénature l’esprit du jeu ». Ces gens là sont des esprits chagrins qui ne le jugent pas comme il devrait être: un jeu fun, pas la suite du messie du FPS.
 
Ragnar le cruel

Évaluation publiée le 11 janvier 2018
Half-Life: Blue Shift
De fato, esse é o Half-Life mais fraco(em minha opinião), Gearbox regrediu do Opposing Force para este, mas não deixa de ser bom.

Neste jogo você controla Barney Calhoun, um dos personagens de Half-Life 2, e sua história de como escapou de Black Mesa.

O jogo não adiciona nem Inimigos, nem Armas(na verdade você tem menos armas que no Half-Life original), o mais diferente desse jogo, é que você ajuda um cientista (Dr. Rosemberg) desde que o resgate, até sair de Black Mesa.

PROS
[+] Novos mapas(óbvio)
[+] Nova História

♥♥♥♥
[-] Menor número de armas
[-] Mesmos inimigos
[-] Poucos personagens(apenas o Dr. Rosemberg e seus aliados)

Finalização
O jogo tem mais contras do que pros, portanto não é recomendado se você não for fã da saga/quer começar a jogar os Half-Life, não passa de uma história alternativa que, embora boa, não adiciona nada muito importante pra Lore dos jogos

Mas denovo, se ja for fã dos jogos, pode jogar que você não vai se arrepender, só espere um desconto

Eu levei 5 horas até terminar o jogo
 
AliCeline

149 produits enregistrés

7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
16.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 septembre 2016
It seems that no matter how good a game series is, it's always destined to have a black sheep, so to speak. Sometimes the game isn't even bad, just not as solid as the rest and people act like by proxy it's the worst thing ever. It happened with Fallout 4 compared to Fallout 3 and New Vegas, and I feel like it happened with Half-Life: Blue Shift.

Half-Life is the second and final expansion pack that Gearbox developed for the original Half-Life, and much like Opposing Force, Blue Shift puts you behind the perspective of another Character during the Black Mesa incident. In Blue Shift, you play as Barney Calhoun, a security guard and familiar face to those who've played Half-Life 2. Much like in Half-Life, Barney is starting his day of work at Black Mesa by commuting via tram, and after arriving at his scattered workplace, he gets his gun and presses a button for some rude as hell scientists in an elevator before everything goes FUBAR. As aliens begin teleporting in from Xen, Barney's elevator crashes into the ground, killing every occupant other than himself. Upon regaining conciousness, Barney sets off on a mission to escape Black Mesa, eventually meeting up with a Dr. Rosenberg, and the two partner up to escape the facility.

One of the greatest criticisms leveled against Blue Shift is that unlike it's sister expansion, Blue Shift does not add in any new weapons or enemies, without even recycling the ones in Opposing Force. Barney also does not gain access to any of the neater weapons that Gordon Freeman was able to get his hands on like the Tau Cannon or the Hive-Hand, the biggest gun Barney is able to weild outside of console commands being the RPG. While these criticisms are certainly valid, it's not fair to say it doesn't bring anything new to the table. Blue Shift is decidedly much more story driven than Opposing Force, as Dr. Rosenberg is a very important character to Blue Shift's story and is one of the few persistant NPC's in the original trilogy. Dr. Rosenberg explains alot of exposition about his old lab in the facility wile also serving as one of the few charaters with the knowledge and equipment to actually escape the facility.

As such, the latter half of the game consists of Barney doing various errands for Rosenberg to help calibrate his antiquated teleportation machines, such as going to set up a machine in the border world and restoring the backup power deep below the lab. Even though this may not seem all that important, it really does help Blue Shift feel like it's own experience, which is also accompanied by the game's unique handling of Armor. Barney is the only protagonist of the GoldSrc games who lacks a form of powered armor, so he must use the armor of his fallen comrades to protect himself. This can make the game feel really tense as armor becomes less of a second health bar and more of a finite resource which is found few and far between the last.

That aside, I feel like the strongest point of Blue Shift is it's level design. The enemy placement and the size of the levels is pretty great, and the Xen levels are honestly really well made compared to the ones in Half-Life. While I'd say Opposing Force has the better gameplay of the two, I feel like Blue Shift's level design is much more consistant than OpFor's. Despite this, the other grave flaw with Blue Shift is it's shortness. Blue Shift seems to end just when it's beginning to get really good, and there's some puzzles in the game that don't make alot of sense initially, like the barrel and TNT puzzle.

At the end of the day, Blue Shift may not be the best Half-Life game and may arguably be the weakest of the expansions, but it's still a Half-Life game, and it's still just a solid shooter in general. The persistant NPC's in the game as well as the level design and the armor tweaks make Blue Shift still a very positive experience overall, and if you liked Opposing Force or just Half-Life in general, you really should play Blue Shift. While less isn't necessarily more here, you can't really go wrong with a bite sized Half-Life.
 
WalterREQUiEM
0
8 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 décembre 2020
Коротко о сюжете игры
Игра происходит параллельно действиям в игре Half-Life 1.
На этот раз мы примеряем на себе образ охранника Black Mesa - Барни Калхуна. Также как и Гордону Фримену после взрыва, мы питаемся сбежать из иследовательного комплекса, сражаясь с инопланетянами и военными. В конце, мы спасаем наших друзей ученых и сваливаем подальше от Black Mesa.

Мой отзыв о игре
Игра годная. Она не такая длинная, как Half-Life, но все равно захватывающая и интересная.
Очень интересно было наблюдать за последствиями неудачного эксперимента глазами обычного, ничем не примечательного охранника, у которого есть только шлем,бронежилет и оружие для защиты!

Стоит ли играть или нет?
Тут уже решать только вам.

Всем спасибо за внимание!

author a écrit :
Diğer oyunlar ile ilgili incelemelerime / indirim duyurularına ulaşmak için buraya tıklayın.

Half Life oynayan çoğu kişinin belkide bilmediği DLC leri aslında bu oyunlar.

Hani Half life başlangıcında trenle iş yerimize giderken gördüğümüz güvenlik görevlisi varya, hani Half Life 2 de karşımıza çıkan sadık dostumuz Barney Calhoun he işte o biziz bu oyunda.

Black Mesa'ya bambaşka bir açıdan bakmamızı sağlayan bu oyun Gordon Freeman canının derdindeyken, etrafı toparlamaya çalışırken Barney'in neler yaptığını onun gözünden görmemizi sağlıyor.

Kesinlikle Half life oynayan herkesin deneyim etmesi gereken yaklaşık 2 saatte biten bir oyun. Fakat tadı damağınızda kalıyor.

Ulan Gaben nerde HL3!!

Évaluation publiée le 23 novembre 2023
Из трех первых, связанных между собой частей на ПК, Half-Life: Blue Shift (2001):
1. Самая приятная
2. Самая релаксная
3. Самая продвинутая
4. Самая душевная история
5. Самые продвинутые ИИ
6. Больше всего взаимодействий с ИИ
7. Самый интересный геймплей до первого выстрела
8. Больше всего аптечек и брони
9. Лучшая графика
10. Менее забагованная
11. Самая легкая в прохождении
12. Самая жадная на боеприпасы
13. Самые забагованные ИИ враги
14. Самая быстрая в прохождении
15. Менее атмосферная
Уровень сложности в игре: Hard.
Моя оценка: 7.7
Смотрите мое мнение на другие части Half-Life в моих обзорах.

Recommandé
6.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 juin 2016
A very short but scintillating expansion. I honestly don't know or don't care why the reviewers scolded this little, innocent expansion so much. It shows us that cute Barney is also a murdering machine which is great I say. The game introduced the Half-Life HD pack. It also has some pretty original puzzles, making the copy-paste Half-Life gameplay a little more sufferable, for the third time in a row. It can't compare with Opposing Force with originality though. It doesn't add new weapons, but it is as full of details as the previous two games. It also has a happy ending, without you being obligatorily captured by G-Man. It features a great character named Dr Rosenberg that you will interact with and help him escape Black Mesa. Oh and you can see Gordon Freeman himself at least 3 times during the play. It's a must for any Half-Life fan, even though it's that short and not extremely inventive, gameplay and story-wise.
 
Globster

Évaluation publiée le 29 décembre 2013
This game will take you about 3.5 hrs to finish, so don't expect anything too epic. Half Life's other expansion, Opposing Force, is superior. Blue Shift is fine if you feel like shooting through a bit of Black Mesa and moving some boxes and barrels around, it just ends up being a little underwhelming. Don't expect any new interesting weapons. Visuals are dated, but that's to be expected. It's worth playing if you're a fan of Half Life and have a few hours to kill.

Évaluation publiée le 2 juillet 2016
Produit reçu gratuitement

Pros:
- Faithful to the original Half-Life formula
- Another fresh take on the original campaign
- New characters!
- New areas of Xen!

♥♥♥♥:
- Outdated game mechanics
As with the others in the series, Blue Shift suffers from some outdated mechanics that don't stand up to today's standards.
- Lack of new content
Unlike Opposing Force, this game lacks any new weaponry or enemies to fight
- Short
Significantly shorter than Opposing Force. This can sometimes be a problem, but makes for a neat, quick playthrough every now and then.

8.5/10
Really only worth your time if you enjoyed the rest of the franchise. It's short length and lack of new content make it not worth the full price.

Non recommandé
12.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 novembre 2017
Un an et demi après le premier add-on d'Half-Life, lui-même sorti un an après le jeu original, nous revoilà à Black Mesa cette fois-ci dans la peau d'un agent de sécurité. D'abord prévu pour sortir sur la console Dreamcast, c'est finalement sur PC que Blue Shift arrivera, sans-doute pour surfer sur le succès (commercial) des 2 précédents opus, à moindre frais question développement. Ceci expliquant peut-être cela.

J'évalue, comme toujours, le jeu tel qu'il était à sa sortie (mi-2001), et je dirais dans le dernier paragraphe ce que j'en pense aujourd'hui, si l'achat vaut encore le coup. A noter que vous pouvez voir les screens que j'ai pris au fur et à mesure de ma progression dans le jeu (44, rangés dans un ordre chronologique) pour vous faire une idée plus précise, surtout qu'ils sont souvent commentés. http://steamcommunity.com/id/Animal_Rights/screenshots/?appid=130&sort=newestfirst&browsefilter=myfiles&view=grid

Graphismes & effets : 10/20. Après des titres comme Project IGI ou No One Lives Forever, et à quelques mois de la sortie de jeux tels qu'Alien Vs Predator 2, Wolfenstein ou encore Max Payne, le coup de vieux est palpable, le moteur d'Half-Life ayant 3 ans maintenant. Le pack dit "HD", inauguré ici sur Blue Shift (BS), n'apporte rien de bien enthousiasmant. Pire, aucun effort n'a été fait sur le level design : c'est vide, plat, sombre, voire moche ; on a l'impression que tout a été fait à la hâte, en particulier sur le monde Alien. Aucune nouvelle créature non plus.

Gameplay/IA : 12/20. Aucun changement. Notre perso se contrôle toujours difficilement quand il s'agit d'être précis, heureusement, il y a moins d'échelles dans BS. Quelques "énigmes" toujours, mais sans grand intérêt. L'IA reste convaincante, les groupes de marines posant souvent problème. Aucune nouvelle arme, on en a même bien moins que dans HL ou Opposing Force, une honte ! D'autant plus qu'il y a moins de diversité dans les ennemis également : on affrontera principalement 3 types d'Aliens, et un type de soldat : le strict minimum. Un ou deux bugs qui peuvent nous bloquer quelques minutes, mais ca reste marginal, la progression est fluide, et l'on se prend au jeu malgré tout.

Durée de vie/difficulté : 5/20. A peine plus de 3h30 en difficile (donc avec quelques passages à recommencer) : lamentable. Le jeu était apparemment vendu 150 francs (22,5€) à sa sortie, ce qui était bien trop vu le peu que BS offrait ; heureusement, Opposing Force était offert avec, redonnant du coup de l'intérêt à un achat, enfin, pour ceux qui n'y avaient pas déjà joué quoi.. La difficulté est qui plus est très inégale : équilibrée au début, on arrive ensuite dans un passage où l'on se retrouve simplement sans munitions, même en ayant fait très attention avant, et donc obligé de venir à bout des Aliens au pied de biche, ce qui n'est franchement pas évident quand il apparaissent à 2 en même temps et qu'on a déjà les PV et l'armure au plus bas. Les soldats offrent ensuite de nouveau une difficulté "hard" bien gérée, mais ca devient bizarrement beaucoup plus facile dans le dernier tiers du jeu... incompréhensible et illogique.

Effets sonores/musique : 12/20. Là encore, aucun changement, le sentiment d'oppression et de danger en moins par rapport aux 2 premiers.

Scénario/immersion : 6/20. Black Mesa dans la peau d'un flic, mouais, voilà. Y'a pas à dire ils se sont pas foulés, aucun rebondissement et une fin sans grand intérêt.


Au final : 8/20. Une sorte de version low-cost d'Half-Life ou d'Opposing Force, réservée aux passionnés de jeux vidéos ou inconditionnels du monde H-L, et en attente d'Half-Life 2, qui arrivera finalement seulement 3 ans plus tard. Bien trop court, on se dit malgré tout qu'un titre à rallonge, étant donné le peu de (nouveau) contenu, n'aurait finalement pas eu grand intérêt. Une triste fin à la saga HL 1, mais à vrai dire, il était temps.


Et aujourd'hui ? Déjà décevant et vieillissant à sa sortie, difficile de le recommander aujourd'hui. Pour nostalgiques only. 5€ (!) sur steam, attendez les soldes qu'il descende à moins de 2 euros, ou achetez le pack HL ou Valve.
 
Αnіmal Rіghts

Évaluation publiée le 31 mai 2020
If you liked Half-Life, Blue Shift is just ok. This is an add-on that doesn't add anything to the game other than offering another view of the Black Mesa facility. The game is exactly like the main game which is a downside since the weapons and enemies are exactly the same. It's not worth buying separately, but it's worth trying if you get it through a bundle with the main game.

Évaluation publiée le 22 mai 2016
This game is shorter than the original Half Life. Much shorter than the original game. But is that a problem? Not really because I still found the game to be enjoyable. Though this is a 2001 game, I felt free to explore and roam which is a refreshing experience. The game doesn't hold you hand at all. It is easier than the original game. Still fun and I reccomend this highly to anyone who can live with older graphics, less hand holding, and minor bugs.

3.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 novembre 2017
Produit reçu gratuitement

In the first half life series, this game was the most dissapointing. Half Life was perfect, Opposing Force was fun, but a little easy and short, but Blue Shift is just not enjoyable. In fact, I found it rather annoying to play. Everyone who played half life know that the security guards are only helpful when it comes to opening doors. But for fighting, they're basically useless. Some of the chapters were near impossible due to a lack of resources, and others were way overly easy due to an abundance of resources and also the locations were easy to kill enemies without being spotted. That is another thing, sometimes in the game you would be spotted by several enemies, and there would be no cover. So there you were, in the middle of the open, being shot at by 8 marines. Half Life and Opposing Force were definitley both worth playing, but I can honestly say that this one is not.

6.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 mai 2023
Este Blue shift junto a Opposing Force forma parte de las 2 expansiones oficiales del primer Half Life, donde volvemos a las instalaciones de Black Mesa para vivir la aventura desde otros puntos de vista completamente diferentes a los de Gordon Freeman, protagonista del primer juego, seremos en este caso Barney Calhoun, el guardia de seguridad que ayudaba a Gordon en el primer juego.

Su duración es bastante inferior a Half Life aunque no faltarán los puzzles y los enfrentamientos ♥♥♥ enemigos mucho más fuertes por lo que normalmente se evitan, la historia la van narrando los personajes que nos encontramos por el camino y debemos afrontar la aventura ahorrando munición y salud. Hay bugs importantes siendo el más habitual quedarse pillado en alguna parte del escenario así que guardar partida cada poco tiempo es muy recomendable para poder solucionarlo sin perder demasiado recorrido.

Es un juego muy bueno, entretiene de principio a fin, pero hoy en día hay que aceptar sus limitaciones técnicas si queremos disfrutarlo.
 
Renegade ツ

Recommandé
0.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 mars 2016
The shortest and least substantial expansion pack to the original Half-Life, Blue Shift puts you in the role of Barney Calhoun, a security officer at Black Mesa on the day of the Black Mesa incident. As with Opposing Force and Decay, this game was developed by Gearbox using assets from the original Half-Life. Blue Shift is by far the shortest of the four campaigns, beatable between 2.5-5 hours depending on the difficulty and your experience with first-person shooters.

This game's initial presentation is very good, but its short traversal and occasionally awkward puzzles put a "damper" on things. There are lots of homages to things that happen in Half-Life, Decay, and Opposing Force. The first chapter is really immersive and is a pretty good setup for the rest of the campaign. Unfortunately, Calhoun is relegated to doing the most mundane stuff in the facility, and it really feels like his story is the least important of the four.

****SPOILERS AHEAD****

Because of the game's brevity, it has to compress things greatly, which sometimes works to the detriment of the game. The difficulty escalates much more quickly than in any of the other campaigns. The second chapter is probably the best, but figuring out what Gearbox was thinking with two of the puzzles (i.e., the weird machines you manipulate vertically and going down an obscured ladder to a completely different area) are hard for me to understand why they were chosen. The third chapter introduces marines and this is where things really get hairy. Unlike every other HL game in my experience, the marines in Blue Shift seem to spam the MP5's grenades the most. It feels artificially difficult because the grenades are very damaging and hard to see coming to dodge.

Also in the third chapter, there is a bit of an escort mission, which is exceedingly annoying because the guy decides to stop following you because he says he's tired. Sometimes this happens after he says he'll follow you and not take a single step. Other times he'll just rush ahead of you, which is also annoying when he gets in harm's way. One of the funniest experiences I think most people have had with him is him saying he won't go another step when he's right in front of the security door that he's been ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ about getting to.

Anyway, after that chapter, you get sent to the alien homeworld and there's a mess of convoluted mazes. This was also the chapter that I discovered Gearbox's proclivity for constantly placing headcrabs right around 90-degree corners in order for them to almost always get a hit on you just because you couldn't see it coming. I thought this was also pretty cheap. There might be multiple ways to get to the destination but I can foresee people getting confused and frustrated with the random organization of everything. Do you take the left path or the right path? It's a lot of trial and error, I think, and I guess I just got lucky. There's also a really annoying platforming section where you have to basically save on every platform. But once you get past that, there's a kind of extended waterfall section that actually feels like it could belong in the original Half-Life. It's certainly better than the factory in Interloper. This is also where you'll encounter almost all of the enemies that Gordon dealt with on Xen, except far, far fewer. After aligning the machinery on Xen, there's again a bit of a head-scratching moment to figure out where to go. You just jump on some crumbled rocks to reach an upper area, d!ck around for a bit (which feels unnecessary), and then find an arbitrary portal back home.

The fifth chapter is the longest and in my opinion the most annoying. You have to find a power cell (battery) in a lower section of Black Mesa. Unfortunately things aren't as intuitive as they should be. For instance, you have to use a barrel as a conduit for a broken wire connected to some dynamite and an explosive lever. You also have to lower the coolant levels just to move some barrels, then raise the coolant levels to jump on the barrels to cross to the other side. But the worst offense (and this is the worst part of the entire game) is figuring out the one extremely random hidden button that raises a bridge to cross to a section you probably didn't even see. This is where the game's lack of explanation drove me batsh!t insane. Anyway, once you figure that all out, you charge the battery and send it back.

The last chapter is pretty easy, you just have to open the damping fields to let the scientists through, then open them for yourself and go through. This is supposed to be tough because of the military guys, but if you know where they're coming from, you can plant a mine and take them out easily.

This game isn't really all that long but it's decent for what it is. There are definitely some moments that are good but probably an equal number of moments that hit with a considerable clunk. It definitely doesn't have the gravitas of the other HL games and some of its puzzles are more annoying than anything. By far the aliens and military spawn point placement in Blue Shift feels the most d!ckish of all the games. But if you can handle those minor annoyances, it's fun to play. But if you're debating between this and Half-Life or Opposing Force, this should be the lowest on your list because it has the least content and feels less substantial (although Calhoun gets the best ending, in my opinion).

P.S. I know it says I have only six minutes in the game. I beat it having "changed game" after having started Opposing Force.
 
Olde

Évaluation publiée le 3 novembre 2016
Дополнение довольно классное, скажу так. Оно дополняет места Блэк Мезы, в которых мы не можем побывать в оригинальной Half-Life и Opposing Force. Да и мы узнаём о докторе Розенберге и прочих личностей. Однако, есть и минусы. Во-первых, Blue Shift быстро проходится. На это тратится всего 2 часа. Во-вторых, бывают баги(правда, некоторые из них можно объяснить обновлением, который произошёл в 2013). В-третьих, он не такой интересный, как Opposing Force. Там были новые монстры и оружия. А тут только карты и модели новые.
В общем, даю игре 9/10.

5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 mai 2020
Half-Life:Blue Shift - второе и последнее дополнение к Half-Life.В отличие от Opposing Force,здесь не было никаких экспериментов,и весь контент взят прямиком из оригинала.Говорить особо не о чем,однако, несколько моментов всё-таки стоит упомянуть:
-Сюжет,который даже не вторично,а третично переплетается с оригиналом в самом начале,и в самом конце.При прохождении отрывка в Зене меня неоднократно посещало чувство дежавю - ощущение что некоторые места прямиком из злоключений Mr.Freeman'а;
-Стычки с противниками,как мне показалось,значительно легче чем в оригинале.А если сравнить с Opposing Force так и подавно.Однозначно,минус,но не критичный;
-Поскудневший на четверть арсенал из оригинала,что даже лучше,чем хуже.Реально же пользуешься Магнумом и Штурмовой Винтовкой,изредка Дробовиком;
-К технической части претензий нет вообще - ни одной проблемы за всё прохождение.
При всей своей простоте и максимально возможному следованию канону,на фоне Opposing Force,Blue Shift по своей атмосфере куда ближе к Half-Life,но дальше к оригиналу подобраться не в состоянии.Поэтому,ситуация такая же,как и с Opposing Force - "Проходняк".Однако,отмечу что Blue Shift,как и Opposing Force является весьма неплохим и качественным аддоном,расширяющим ЛОР Half-Life,который стоит потраченных денег и времени.
Подлежит к ознакомлению при условии,что был пройден оригинал.

https://steamcommunity.com/id/Ancient_Legend/recommended/70/ - рецензия на Half-Life
https://steamcommunity.com/id/Ancient_Legend/recommended/50/ - рецензия на Half-Life: Opposing Force
https://steamcommunity.com/id/Ancient_Legend/recommended/280/ - рецензия на Half-Life: Source
https://steamcommunity.com/id/Ancient_Legend/recommended/220/ - рецензия на Half-Life 2
https://steamcommunity.com/id/Ancient_Legend/recommended/340/ - рецензия на Half-Life 2: Lost Coast
https://steamcommunity.com/id/Ancient_Legend/recommended/380/ - рецензия на Half-Life 2: Episode 1
https://steamcommunity.com/id/Ancient_Legend/recommended/420/ - рецензия на Half-Life 2: Episode 2
https://steamcommunity.com/id/Ancient_Legend/recommended/290930/ - рецензия на Half-Life 2: Update
https://steamcommunity.com/id/Ancient_Legend/recommended/362890/ - рецензия на Black Mesa

Recommandé
5.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 mai 2022
Review of Half-Life: Blue Shift
The second official expansion to the original Half-Life, developed by Gearbox Software, putting you in the shoes of Barney Calhoun. A Black Mesa security guard, who's ready for another long & uneventful day on the job. I'm certain nothing at all would happen here at the Black Mesa Research Facility that could cause some kind of catastrophic emergency... Right?

Originally a Sega Dreamcast exclusive chapter, was turned into a standalone PC experience after that console's short lifespan came to an end prior to Blue Shift's release.

I highly recommend you read my previous review first, on Half-Life, for greater context to my discussion.

Security Shift
While Blue Shift was released after Opposing Force, like it & the original game, the events of the story canonically play out alongside each other. So there's no harm in playing this one before Opposing Force or even Half-Life. The references to said game, can be experienced both as someone jumping from this one to that one, or vice versa. Personally, I choose to play Blue Shift immediately after the original Half-Life. Due to its smaller content amount and shorter length in comparison.

It's quite enjoyable to be running parallel to the events of Half-Life. While still utilizing the same methods of story telling & world building. In-fact, you'll start your journey on a tram ride not unlike Gordon does. It's also quite interesting for it to be themed after the Black Mesa security branch. Instead of an HEV suit & its power, you rely on body armor. Instead of the classic orange HUD, you have a stylish and superior blue HUD (Don't @ me). Simultaneously giving us a different perspective of the Resonance Cascade event. It's exciting, not knowing when it's going to occur, but knowing it's coming. Then watching just how much chaos was unleashed across the facility first hand. There are multiple direct references to Half-Life, such as seeing Gordon more than once, Half-Life: Decay, at the time an upcoming PlayStation 2 exclusive co-op chapter, and Half-Life: Opposing Force, the first expansion. More importantly, as far as narrative is concerned, you'll learn just a tad more about what Black Mesa was up to that lead to the events of the original game.

Barney Calhoun, an important character to the franchise's story, isn't just sitting around waiting for the whole thing to blow over. Like everyone, your main goal is the get the Hell out. Running through entirely new areas of Black Mesa, visiting the border world of Xen once more, and hopefully escaping with your skin still attached. However, the pacing of Blue Shift is quite a bit.. off, feeling. Of course, you cannot parallel one to one as each player's experience is going to be slightly different per game. Here though, events that you'd expect to come later in the original game, occur almost immediately in the story here, or after roughly an hour of play (Including an important Gordon scene). This isn't a complaint mind you, and I'm sure there's some sort of explanation to be given, just something I noticed.

In regards to the pacing, if you were hoping for another Opposing Force style expansion, you're unfortunately going to be disappointed. The narrative additions and handful of new areas, are really the only 'new' content you can expect in Blue Shift. You'll not fight any new Xen creatures, or HECU, nor will you acquire any weapons/gadgets unique to this expansion. On the contrary, there's actually way less than the original game here. Only a handful of core weapons will be at your disposal. Not bad, but a let down if you were hoping for more like Opposing Force gave. I'd say overall, Blue Shift is mainly just about introducing Barney Calhoun, and how his journey leads to the next installment. With that being said, if feels as though areas are a bit more detailed than the Half-Life.
|
The length of an entire playthrough is also drastically shorter than the original game + Opposing Force. Coming in at a staggeringly low 1-2 hours. Leaning more towards the 2~ hour range for a first playthrough, perhaps. You can practically blink, and the game is over. As an add-on to your Half-Life experience, that's just an extra bit of playtime, but if you're treating this as it can be treated, a standalone experience, you may be underwhelmed. On top of that, the difficulty is far lower than previous titles. Ammunition also never really becoming an issue like it can in Half-Life.

Across my short playthrough, I experienced a handful of bugs that did not occur in the original game (For me, at least). None of these were game breaking, but could be slightly annoying depending on your level of tolerance. The most common one I was experiencing was when dying from gibs, I would reload firing my gun continuously until I clicked to cancel out the firing. Even if I wasn't shooting upon death. Another I experienced was this strange... almost rubber banding effect where my mouse would snap around and I'd seemingly teleport a few feet. I was able to fix this issue with an online thread post. During the Xen portion, I managed to get stuck in mid air, but was able to free myself.

HD Pack
Released with Blue Shift was a high definition upgrade pack that covered the original game and its two expansions. It focused up upgrading weapon models, a handful of props/interactive objects, as well as some NPC's & creatures. The actual reception of this pack seems to be hit or miss among fans. I didn't mention it in my review of Half-Life, but you have the option to manually turn the HD pack on or off (It's on by default). I tend to keep it off, with the exception of Blue Shift, as it was released with it.

Some of the new models look great in my opinion, while others completely rework the visuals of weapons, and can feel a bit out of place with the rest of the game's visuals. Weapons like the shotgun look great with the upgrade, but changing the classic Glock-17 to a Baretta isn't to my liking. I'm indifferent on the MP5 submachine change.

Unfortunately, no changes were made to the game's flashlight, as it doesn't mess with the engine's lighting mechanics. The flashlight being a bit of a difficult tool to use in the original game as well.

Conclusion (Pros & ♥♥♥♥)
The best way I can describe Blue Shift is a bonus spurt of original Half-Life story, that sets up a character for the events that'll follow in the sequels. It is a downgrade in regards to playable content though, so take that as you will.

Pros:
+More story context
+Barney Calhoun's introduction
+Atmospheric storytelling
+Blue HUD

Neutral:
~Insanely short (1-2 hours)
~Handful of none-game breaking bugs
~Vacant OST(?)
~HD Pack

♥♥♥♥:
-Large drop in difficulty

Disclaimer
Thank you for taking the time to read my review. Please remember, that this is just my opinion. We don't have to agree, one thing I love you may hate, and one thing I hate you may love. Hopefully this gave you an idea of what to expect.

Review lengths have been greatly compressed due to the character limit.

5/16/2022
 
🌸 [WC]~Tigerfrost~! 🌸
1,618 produits enregistrés
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 mars 2021
Well, Half-Life: Blue Shift is still a good game after all this years.
Troubleshooting - Like the other two games from the first series, Blue Shift do not boot directly on Linux Manjaro, despite that it is a Linux native game. But again, the compatibility with the latest Proton 5.13-6 works perfectly. I mean too perfectly - even the (in)famous glitch from back in the day is here. After reloading a quick save the current weapon starts automatically shooting until it is switched. Well, when people are saying that Proton compiles games perfectly, I didn't expected that even the original glitches will be transferred. Anyway, as I said - most of the glitches are from the game itself and not from the compatibility layer. Also, it comes with installed HD-pack. This means that the Glock, the MP5 and the shotgun are reskinned to Beretta, M16 and SPAS.
Quality - Even that the game is much shorter that the previous two, it is still enjoyable. Honestly I rather prefer "Blue Shift" then "Opposing Force". Maybe because the main character is an average security guard instead of a spec-force commando or a scientist in a high-tech suit.
Final thoughts - As we all know: "the best friend of the gamer is the seasonal sale". So, It is better to wait for discount and buy one of the bundles.

Recommandé
3.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 décembre 2020
Half-Life: Blue Shift - A Good Game Doesn't Have To Be Long

Released in 2001 HL:BS follows the story of security guard Barney Calhoun and his experience during the events of the MESA incident. The game has a few memorable characters but not because they have any voice-lines, it's because their one of few characters in this game (unless you count the people shooting at you). While this isn't necessarily a bad thing in typical HL fashion this story isn't one to write home about or lose your nut over. Although, seeing the events unfold from the perspective of a guard is quite intriguing to say the least and we see many parts of MESA that I wish I had seen in the original HL

The graphics are obviously a bit dated in 2020 but I quite enjoy the pixelated character models and low resolution sounds, it's very retro and quite nostalgic and considering the technical limitations of the engine they were using as well as the time period I'd say this is pretty impressive.

I very much enjoyed this game with my only problem being it's length. The game can be beat in about 2 hours on a casual play-through and unless you are trying to complete it on the hardest difficulty level then there is no real level of replay-ability which is a shame as this is such a fun little expansion.

To conclude I'd only play HL:BS if you've played HL1 and wan't more sweet MESA action! It's low replay-ability level and length is definitely a bummer but that doesn't stop it from being a good game.

8.2/10 ~ Neppy Review
 
Neppy
111 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
12.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 janvier 2023
Недооценённая игра, которая не пытается подкупить вас сотней новых пушек и толпой новых врагов.

Наконец то имеется история, в которой есть персонажи, в которой главный герой - тоже персонаж. Очень много паззлов, ориентированных на взаимодействие с окружением - банальных "покрути вентиль, нажми кнопочку - дверь откроется" практически нет. Ещё хорошим плюсом является отсутствие расы-X и в целом, более взрослое отношение к вселенной half-life, чем у предыдущей игры Gearbox. Достойный спин-офф, который не станет душить вас однообразием.


К сожалению, в стиме нет HL:Decay, поэтому этот обзор на блю шифт станет заодно и обзором на дикэй:
Decay предоставляет редкую, на время релиза, возможность кооперативного сюжетного прохождения. Динамика головоломок и динамика перестрелок очень в духе оригинальной игры. Большое упущение, что в это трудно поиграть. Но если в вашем ближайшем окружении есть верный товарищ, который так же прётся по халф-лайфу - вы сможете получить чуть ли не столько же удовольствия, как от кооператива второго Поратала.
 
M.K. (MyCbEH)

7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 mars 2020
Сюжет про человека, который меньше всех мог совершить в сложившейся обстановке. У него и оружия меньше, и нет супер-костюма, инопланетян поголовно не истребляет, и G-Man'у он неинтересен. Простому охраннику просто нужно выжить и выбраться из опасной передряги.

Единственная из трех игр, где мне попадались "неясные" моменты, когда я бегал взад-вперед и не знал, куда нужно тыкнуть. Таких места было всего три-четыре, в одном случае даже подсмотрел в прохождение. По существу, здесь больше ситуаций, где нужно слегка подумать.

2.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 janvier 2015
Blue Shift is the second and last Half-Life expansions. This puts you in Barney's, the police officer, shoes. Again, same as with Opposing Force you are caught in the same storyline as Gordon Freeman from the original Half-Life. You will see Gordon Freeman once or twice, to help you get your bearings on where you are within the timeline of the original game, similar to Opposing Forces. This game is short, simple and doesn't add much more to the original game or the first expansion. The storyline is mediocre at best, but since this is a Half-Life game, I must recommend. Just know that if you're not a fan of Half-Life, this game will not be the entertainment that you are looking for that the other Half-Life games will offer.

Évaluation publiée le 21 mai 2017
Em Half Life: Blue Shift, vc esta no controle de Calhoun um segurança da Black Mesa.

Enquanto esta-o comandando ocorre o incidente e vc sobreviveu, durante todo o jogo vc tem o objetivo de retirar alguns cientistas sobreviventes do complexo, com a ajuda dos proprios e do teletransporte.

O jogo assim como o Half-Life é muito frenetico todo o tempo e com muitos puzzles.

Enfim, é um ótimo jogo.. Afinal é Valve né.

Não sou Gordon, mas sou tao f0da quanto!

☐ ARK: Survival Evolved
☐ The game itself is a big terrarium for bugs

ArticcZ
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 septembre 2016
Half-Life: Blue Shift is an expansion pack for Half-Life and was made by Gearbox. You are playing as security officer Barney Calhoun in Black Mesa when ♥♥♥♥ hits the fan. While Opposing Force brought new content to the franchise, Blue Shift didn't, really.

pros
+ Background story for Barney Calhoun
+ Half-Life fans might want to play it at least once.
+ Health packs
+ More Half-Life to see

♥♥♥♥
- Rather short
- Doesn't add much to the Half-Life universe
- It stops abruptly
- Less interesting puzzles than Opposing Force's
- No subtitles

Verdict
I'd recommend buying Half-Life: Blue Shift if you are a die-hard Half-Life fan and can't get enough. Keep in mind though that Opposing Force is superior to Blue Shift in every way. Since Blue Shift is such a short experience, I would recommend getting it on a sale.

If you are not a Half-Life fan, but like FPS don't get this game. It's an average game and there are better and longer alternatives to this.

Replay value: Average
Rating: 6.5/10
Recommendation: Yes if you are a Half-Life fan. Otherwise stay away
 
Syfy
1
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 aout 2015
It's quite short expansion, but it's very good. This time you return to the Black Mesa Research Facility as a security guard Barney Calhoun. After playing Half Life: Opposing Force I was glad to have my flashlight and crowbar on full power back. You don't get any special weapons to fight with and you won't fight any new enemies. Your mission is simply to find and save several scientists who will rely on you that you are able to do all the dirty work which leads to getting out of the facility unharmed. You won't get stuck in the map in this second expansion. Yay! Success! Recommended! Time to move on to Half Life 2!

Évaluation publiée le 26 aout 2023
Увлекательное дополнение, которое позволяет вам продолжить свое приключение в мире Half-Life. Хотя оружие, монстры и персонажи могут быть знакомыми из основной игры, Blue Shift все равно предлагает интересный игровой процесс. Графика и звуковое оформление соответствуют высокому стандарту серии. Blue Shift дополняет и расширяет историю Half-Life, предоставляя новые моменты и перспективы. В целом, игра является интересным вариантом для фанатов Half-Life, которые хотят продолжить свое путешествие в этом захватывающем мире.
 
qtin666
203 produits enregistrés
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 juillet 2022
It's not that I wouldn't recommend the game, but Steam reviews don't give you many rating options. I just don't think it deserves the same rating as the original or Opposing Force given the horrible amount of bugs and rather bland gameplay.

This game has about 3 hours of gameplay. It took both me and my boyfriend 3 and half hours to finish it, and if we both didn't get stuck searching for a ladder in the underground, I think it would be almost exactly 3 hours.

I experienced this really annoying bug where every time I reloaded the game, the guy started shooting. No matter what save it was, if I reloaded it myself or I died. There were like ten different places I got stuck – jumping or crouching didn't help, and I had to reload the game.

Gameplay-wise, I really struggled at the beginning because of the lack of ammo. There was a segment where I had to rush a corridor full of aliens because I simply didn't have any ammo. But once you met the soldiers, you earned a ton of it and the game became super easy.

Story wise, I enjoyed the beginning because I really like seeing one situation from different angles. But then it got kinda boring. Let's just say I expected a bit more, because it looked very promising at first. There was a point where the scientist said "you gotta retrieve a power cell", and I thought "this feels like there will be another chapter, but I doubt they would make a chapter based on retrieving a power cell", and then the title "Power Struggle'' appears. So yeah, the story is so-so.

Oh and I hated the part in the already mentioned Power Struggle where you have to connect a cut detonator by a barrel. I thought about it but then didn't say it out loud because I thought my bf would think I am an idiot for even thinking that it could work. Well that's exactly what you are supposed to do and it just doesn't make much sense to me.

Recommandé
2.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 juin 2023
It's lackluster if you compare it to the opposing force expansion.
I did enjoy solving some of the puzzles and shooting but overall has no depth into core gameplay, the same old weapons, pretty short, and is just a mild experience overall.
The opposing force expansion, on the other hand, does better at everything that the blue shift offers. New weapons, companions who can actually be useful in gameplay, and playing as a Shepherd, which was honestly story-wise much more interesting to play than Barney to me.

This game is just like a regular pepperoni pizza. it's not special, but it's good anyway.
If you need more of that good old slice of half-life experience, go for it.
 
Truly Madly Derply

Évaluation publiée le 18 décembre 2023
Хорошее дополнение к оригинальной Half-Life, каноничность которого также ставится под сомнение.

Оно, как и Opposing Force происходит параллельно событиям игры. Мы играем за Барни Калхауна, офицера охраны Чёрной Мезы. И в нём показана его история и то, что произошло с ним до событий Half-Life 2.

В целом, получилось неплохо, однако до Opposing Force всё же не дотягивает. Нет никаких новых геймплейных фишек и механик, а также нового оружия.

Также, является достаточно коротким, проходится в среднем за 2-3 часа. Рекомендую пройти для общей целостности.

Évaluation publiée le 27 juin 2013
-: hracia doba, slabá atmosféra, žiadni noví nepriatelia a zbrane, žiaden MP, dizajn niektorých miest v hre

+: ďalší datadisk k Half-Life, Barney, niektoré lokácie, momenty nadväzujúce na pôvodný Half-Life a Opposing Force

Verdikt: Po veľkolepom Half-Life a slušnom Opposing Force je Blue Shift jednoznačne sklamaním v tejto sérii. Vďaka postave Barneyho Calhouna je príbeh prepojený s pôvodným Half-Life a trochu aj s Opposing Force. Hra neprináša do série nič nového. To sa týka ako nepriateľov, tak aj zbraní. Blue Shift má taktiež slabšiu atmosféru oproti predchádzajúcim dielom série a pre istotu nemá ani multiplayer. Žalostným faktom je krátka hracia doba. Hru možno dohrať za jedno odpoludnie alebo večer. Celkovo je Blue Shift hrou pre fanúšikov a zberateľov Half-Life, pre ostatných iba priemernou FPS.

52%
 
NORD
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 avril 2017
Half-Life Blue Shift takes place while Half-Life 1 takes place. You play as a security guard who does things while the events of Half-Life 1 unfold.

Overall the game is pretty fun, especially if there is any nostalgia feel for you. The game plays almost exactly like Half-Life 1, with the environment, weapons, enemies, and almost everything being the same as Half-Life 1 (DUH its the same time). There aren't as many creative ways to finish some of the levels and overall Half-Life Blue Shift is a bit less complex and a whole lot shorter.

If you are a Half-Life fan, this is a great game, especially since it sets up one of the main characters to come.

Rating: 8.8/10
Recommend Price: $2.49 or below
 
berzha101
4,113 produits enregistrés
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
14.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 mars 2017
Not good at writing reviews but I'll try my best to cover everything :)
But before we continue I advise you to play the original Half-Life (Read my review for Half-Life Here )



Review
Half-Life: Blue Shift (HL:BS) is an expansion pack for Valve's FPS game Half-Life The Gameplay doesn't differ much from the original game
You play the role of Barney Calhoun a security guard for Black Mesa facility,the game takes place in the same universe as the original Half-Life your obejctive is to evacuate the scientists trapped inside black mesa and escape the with them but things change quickly as you encounter aliens and the commando group affiliated with US government known as the Black Ops . I don't want to spoil the story anymore play this game and discover for yourself ;)

Let's jump to pros and ♥♥♥♥

Pros:
+Extremely Challenging
+Hard to beat the enemies (even on easy difficulty)
+Variety of weapons (About 14-15)
+Amazing Graphics (For a video game that was developed in 2001)
+Nice Gameplay
+The game is challenging you won't be able to beat this game easily in Short It's not your average run and shoot game instead of hunting down waves after waves of enemies there are a lot of puzzles in the game you have to solve in order to proceed to next level only intelligent people are able to do so (Seriously)
+Great soundtracks
+Physics is perfect (almost)
+Maps are very detailed (for a game developed in GoldSrc Engine)
+Hard to beat enemies
+Great Environment (The feeling of being alone and surrounded by enemies from all sides)
+Mod Support

♥♥♥♥:
-Extremely Buggy (It was difficult to complete the game I had to keep loading the same save file over and over again at some levels for example:-sometimes a door won't open,npcs wont respond,buttons wont work but loading the save file again would solve the problem xD)
-A VERY SHORT story

Overall Rating:-7.5/10
Although I did enjoy this game but due its short story I recommend you to buy it during the sale it doesn't deserve $5

Zarathustra
640 produits enregistrés
0
8 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
4.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 janvier 2023
This game is a 1000x better than Half-Life. The story and gameplay didn't outwear its stay. Even if we are in the year of 2023, I can still recommend this game to anyone wanting to play something from the Half-Life universe and have a great experience.

Given that this is not the main story, you really dont need to have played the previous Half-Life game to play this game as it works perfectly as a standalone story, seperate from Half-Life. It's what you'd expect from your typical earliest 2000 FPS games. The graphics are way outdated and really aesthetically unappeasing AF; your eyes might just bleed a little from the ugly blocky choppy graphics while squinting the hardest you possibly can. to make out the ugly details, but its from 2001, what did you expect. And the sound is also pretty horrible, but not as bad as the graphics, but... here is the bread and butter of Half-Life Blue Shift, is the tempo of the game. It never drags on and you can be done in 3-4 hours of gameplay YAAAJJJ!!! No fillers, no sections where you feel like "maaaan how much longer does this piece of game have to go on, enough already", that feeling is never present.

The game is pretty straightforward; the puzzles are pretty ok except for the first one with the lifts, which is so unclear to be honest. You are not given any hints if your settings are ok or if you need to adjust, just remember the ctrl+jump, cause its definitely needed, there. I said it, and I would be pretty thankful if someone from Gearbox would have tested the puzzle and told me so as well CTRL+jump.

Otherwise the game runs fairly smoothly (its from 2001, if you cant run this game on your computer, let me know and ill go and light a candle for you somewhere). Its engaging and its fun through and through, even in 2023. Half-Life Blue Shift is everything that Half-Life wasn't --> short and fun. As long as you keep your expectations in check, play this game and go on a nostalgic trip down memory lane and enjoy. I know I did!
 
Bobba_fat_(SWE)
1,038 produits enregistrés
0
8 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
4.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 juin 2015
初代Half-Lifeの追加シナリオですね。
時間軸はHalf-Lifeでゴードン・フリーマンがBLACKMESA研究所に出向くオープニングと全く同じ時間にはじまり、
研究所の警備員「バーニィ・カルフーン」が主人公のアザーサイドストーリーです。
BLACKMESAで起きてしまった実験の失敗に拠る異次元からのエイリアンの侵攻を別視点で描きます。
バーニィは続編のHalf-Life2でも重要なサブキャラクターとして登場します。
Half-Lifeのオープニングで冒頭に最初に映り込む警備員がバーニィ・カルフーンです。
さて、肝心のゲーム内容ですがボリューム自体は少なめ。ゆっくりプレイしてもクリアまで３～４時間程度でしょうか。
ただ、スケールの小さい作品なりにHalf-Lifeの要素である物理パズルや謎解き、異世界Xenステージなどエッセンスは上手く纏めてある印象です。恒例の「トレーニングモード」はHalf-Lifeと全く一緒でした。
主人公はHalf-Lifeの主人公が身につける特殊なスーツ（HEVスーツ）を着ていませんのでHEVスーツのシールド回復器ではシールドを回復できません。
名誉の戦死を遂げた仲間が落とすプロテクター＆ヘルメットを取るとシールドが回復します。
シールドの回復手段など本編とは微妙な違いがありますが、操作感覚はまったく一緒ですね。特に新規の武器などは無いです。
ゴードン・フリーマンの相棒であるバールも出てきますが、今回銃弾は潤沢にありますのでわざわざ弾丸の節約の為のバール攻撃は必要ありませんでした。
主な目的は、BLACKMESA研究所に残った研究員を救出援護しつつ、エイリアンや情報隠蔽に派遣された特殊部隊の攻撃から生き延び脱出することです。
終盤では特殊部隊に襲われて気を失い両側から引き摺られるゴードン・フリーマンの姿が確認できます。
Half-Life1がなくてもプレイは出来ますが、細かい演出の意図などはわからないでしょう。
逆にHalf-Lifeをやりこんだ人ほどキャラクターの交差、別視点でのHalf-Life世界の楽しみ方が出来ると思います。
開発は、Borderlandsシリーズでお馴染みのGearsBoxSoftwareが行っています。
 
seiichirou2
0
10 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
6.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 novembre 2020
This spin-off with a third perspective on the main story is a let-down. Much shorter version than the original and it's relative "Opposing Force". Puzzles are not necessarily complex, just annoying. Not enough overlapping with the main story. The character development is bad, but the world exploration and point of view, contrary to the other ♥♥♥♥ are good. They give a nice inner look at the Black Mesa security. The build-up is nice but the ending felt anticlimactic. If you are a big fan of the series then sure, get it on sale, but if you just picked Half-Life and you wonder if Blue Shift is any good - don't bother.

Score - 4.5/10
 
Mikhaʾel

Évaluation publiée le 11 février 2018
Если вы играли в "Half-Life", то наверняка помните охранников, которые обещают купить Гордону пиво.
Дело в том, что вы будете играть за одного из них...
Half-Life:Blue Shift-это DLC для оригнальной игры которая, расскажет вам историю простого охранника Барни Колхуна, который не успев опомниться сразу попадает в круговорот событий. Эта игра доказывает, то что помимо Гордона крутым "РЕМБО" способен быть и простой "секьюрити" (правда если он конечно под управление игрока, как в случае с Барни). В общем Blue Shift-это достойное дополнение хоть к сожалению и короткое, но богатое на события. Советую тем кто хочет знать через, что прошел Барни (это ещё тот самый чел в костюме комбайна, который спас вас в начале второй халвы).
8 купленного пива
из
10!
 
Belowovie

Évaluation publiée le 28 juin 2020
I'd leave a negative review for the HD pack but the rest of the game good. Not as much ♥♥♥♥ added as Opposing Force but still good. Oh btw its a unspoken rule in the Half-Life community that you keep that ♥♥♥♥ off. Played the won version which has less errors. Use a Blue Shift unlocked tool, to convert it to normal HL. Just watch out tho, the version i tried years ago missed a map, in the trainyard. Edit the mod name in liblist.gam to match actual blue shift if you care about tracked hours. Probably the folder too.
 
Detective Kat 🔎
33
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 mars 2023
Half-Life: Blue Shift has the exact same gameplay as the first game, so if you enjoyed Half-Life, you will probably enjoy this one as well.

The game doesn't have boss fights, unless you count tank encounters. And the short runtime of the game means that the story is extremely basic, however it does help to expand the worldbuilding.

Overall, it is a great addition to the Half-Life franchise.
 
RGS
261 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
11.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 aout 2023
"Barney, you are late for your shift" if it was a game. And it is. A Gearbox game. However this doesn't have Randy Pitchford's grease coating it!

You take the role of Barney Calhoun, a security guard for Black Mesa. This game is a side story to Half-Life, and is sort of flawed. By that, I mean in terms of the story. Basically, it all comes down to finding scientists who berate you and yell all the time. Luckily, Duke Nukem is in this game! A.k.a. Jon St. John (who also voiced like 90% of the marines in Opposing Force, HL1's first expansion pack because this is the second) who voices a scientist named "Dr. Rosenberg" in this expansion. Without any spoilers, get this expansion on sale with HL1 (if you don't have it already) and Opposing Force. The deal is absolutely worth it!

Évaluation publiée le 15 aout 2023
游戏本身中规中矩，实际上就相当于是个大型支线任务，以本尼，一个保安的视角来讲述逃出黑山基地的故事，但受到半条命1和针锋相对的对比就显得逊色很多，毕竟弗里曼和谢泼德是被Gman选中的男人，而主角只是一个普通保安，所以在战斗和故事上就没有前两作那么优秀惊艳，再加上本作在任务指引上也有点问题，需要听完对话才能继续任务，所以会经常出现无法触发卡关的情况。

Évaluation publiée le 21 décembre 2019
Blue Shift - довольно короткое, но все же добротное дополнение, которое тем не менее чувствуется, как нечто сделанное "крайне осторожно". После Opposing Force оно выглядит гораздо скромнее: здесь нет новых пушек, врагов, все сделано в рамках того, что было в оригинальной игре, тем не менее здесь нашлось место своей истории, которая как бы расширяет оригинальную, новым персонажам и интересным локациям. В общем вроде бы ничего особенного, но со вкусом.

Évaluation publiée le 15 octobre 2014
This game is short and sweet. It retells the early parts of Half-Life's story from a different perspective. This game is more Half-Life with extra story elements; do not expect anything more.

If one plans on playing both expansions, play this one first. Otherwise, one may feel underwhelmed by this game after playing Opposing Force.

Évaluation publiée le 31 janvier 2022
Unfortunately no new weapons or anything new from half life, but I think it's still very enterteining. It is like original half life but you play as Barney Calhoun who is trying to escape from black mesa after big accident, The game is easy, i had no problems playing it on hard first try. The downside is that the game has aged a bit, its short and had some glitches, but they weren't gamebreaking. I recommend this game, but it get it on sale (ussualy -80% or -90%) or just get it in a package.

Recommandé
1.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 février 2023
I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.
 
de_rumbalz

7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
16.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 janvier 2015
Tras más de cinco años sin volverlo a tocar he decidido rejugarlo a máxima dificultad para comprobar si aún ofrecía reto... ¿El resultado? Un pelín mediocre.
No deja de ser otro HL clásico, pero si lo comparamos ♥♥♥ el original Half-Life o ♥♥♥ Opposing Force no les llega más allá de la altura del zapato. No voy a ♥♥♥♥♥ que entretiene, que su ambiente está bien logrado y que el capítulo de Xen que nos ofrece es bastante bueno, pero caray... ¡Que no dura el gameplay ni 3 horas! Parece más bien un fan mod que una expansión oficial de Gearbox.
Siempre me ha parecido un stepback si jugaste previamente a HL y Opposing Force ya que de primeras no conseguimos nuevas armas, ni nos enfrentamos a nuevos aliens/zombis (ni siquiera llegas a pillar todas las armas originales de Half-Life) así que obviamente Blue Shift te puede decepcionar un poco.
Ah, por cierto, tampoco tiene multiplayer.

Puntuación personal del juego: 7 ★★★

Melancholy
228 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
81.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 mai 2018
Leftover bits and pieces from Half-Life and the first, and far superior, expansion Opposing Force? Maybe. However, you get to play as Barney, and what kind of Half-Life fan doesn't find that appealing? The campaign is very short at easily under three hours if you run and kill at a decent speed. There is no multiplayer unlike Opposing Force. Only a selection of baddies and weapons from the original game are included. This isn't surprising considering Blue Shift was originally intended as addition levels for the doomed Dreamcast version of Half-Life. The graphics are slightly improved upon those of Half-Life and Opposing Force. These HD models are sadly missing from Half-Life: Source. Blue Shift is the only Half-Life game which probably still has a significant amount of time to be cut from current speedrunning attempts. Anyone hoping for a Source remake a la Black Mesa should not hold their breath!

*For those wanting a bit more Half-Life 1 I recommend finding the PC port of the Playstation 2 expansion Half-Life: Decay. This is a co-op game for two players which occurs in Black Mesa in the same timeline as the other games.
 
Shakespeare
697 produits enregistrés
0
12 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 février 2014
Так получилось, что многие аспекты Opposing Force сама Valve и многие игроки считают «неканоническими», вследствие чего Gearbox делала Blue Shift максимально близкой по духу к оригинальной HL. Понравится вам дополнение или нет, зависит от того как вы относитесь к самой вселенной HL и аддону OF в частности. Лично мне OF нравится, поэтому я считаю BS шагом назад. Но история Барни Калхауна (непростительно короткая) все же цепляет. В 1 раз я познакомился с BS, после прохождения HL2. Хотелось узнать как он спасся из комплекса Black Mesa, что пережил, ну и как это состыкуют с историей Фримана.
Рекомендую исключительно фанатам всего, что начинается со словосочетания Half-Life, кому OF показалась сильно "другой".
7/10
 
Hard

Évaluation publiée le 26 septembre 2019
Very interesting game, this is continuation original Half-Life. Rather intetersting and difficult missions, but is so short story. Reccomend who love Half-life to play in this game! There are playlist with full walktrough https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL8mew_CQr9JLvxVpcFgCNeGHdY81l_7A7
Интересная игра, продолжении оригинального сюжета Half-life только от лица охраника. Миссии интересные, заставляют кое где проявить смекалку и раскинуть мозгами, но сюжет довольно короткий в отличии от оригинальной халфы. Кому понравилось 1 халфа, советую всем ее пройти!
Полное прохождение можете найти здесь https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL8mew_CQr9JLvxVpcFgCNeGHdY81l_7A7
