Recommandé
4.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 décembre 2017
Pequeño Comentario Analítico: "Half-LIfe: Blue Shift"

Half-Life: Blue Shift es la expresión más básica y simplona de una expansión, repite a efectos prácticos todo lo que fue el primer título y su aporte se limita a nuevos mapas.

Es divertido y tiene momentos interesantes, pero el argumento de Barney no contribuye en nada a la franquicia y en algunos puntos deja huecos argumentales.

¿En conclusión? Es una buena expansión, pero no es nada interesante.
 
Valinypse 幻
1,166 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 mai 2019
Takes around 3 hours to complete, and it certainly does not get boring during that time.
Just don't make the mistake of assuming that it can rival the main game. The time just doesn't allow for good pacing, and while some combat situations are great, others are not.
Still, well worth the money spent. If you're intro retro FPS, that is.
 
RedRaven
384 produits enregistrés
0
9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
5.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 mars 2017
I have loved the Half-Life series for years now, to which the Black Mesa parking pass on my car and the Gordon Freeman figure on my desk will attest. But for some reason, I'd never gotten around to playing Blue Shift -- I knew the story, but I'd never fired up the game itself. Feeling nostalgic, I thought I'd give it a go.

I can see now why it has a reputation as the weakest entry in the series. The puzzles are a bit tedious, and Xen is as much of a slog as ever. While you do get a glimpse of the G-Man and Dr. Freeman, there's never that sense of mystery that the other games have. If you are a completionist and fan of the Half-Life games, by all means play it (it's short, and just over three hours or so), but there's nothing in either the gameplay or story to really draw you in.
 
[2o2p] OrDaned
257 produits enregistrés
1
10 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 décembre 2019
The shortest of the two Half-Life expansions, and unlike Opposing Force, it lacks any new guns or enemies. Nonetheless it's still Half-Life game done proper, and this time you play as Barney Calhoun, a security guard that would later make a reappearance in the sequel.

The premise is same as usual, you come to Black Mesa, bad things happen, now you gotta run for it. The plot is so much more straightforward, there's no detours to launch a rocket or deal with other problem like that. Hence the shorter length. Here it's, just, like, you come to work, appreciate the disfunctional infrastructure of Black Mesa before alien poop hits the fan, then traverse some areas until you learn of old teleportation system prototype, rescue the scientist who knows hot to operate it, get a short trip to Xen and to return power to the thing, and then you dash for it. Overall you get, like, 6 weapons total over duration of entire expansion, and there is no HEV suit - you only got guard vests and helmets to salvage. That's a nice detail to be honest, there are HEV chargers all over the place but since you don't have the suit they are useless.

I probably would recommend AGAINST buying this, but even the default price is 4 euros/dollars tops and it goes down to 39 cents during sale, seemingly the lowest sale price on Steam, definitely worth it!
 
Tleno
639 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
10.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 septembre 2019
El juego nos convierte en Barney Calhoun, uno de los muchos guardias de seguridad de Black Mesa, quien vive al mismo tiempo que Gordon Freeman el incidente de Black Mesa, pero en otros momentos y lugares... Como ven no seremos héroes encarnando a Freeman ni villanos siendo Shepard, sino que estaremos en el punto medio .Argumentalmente me parece mejor que Opposing Force y al ver que sucede en la misma linea del tiempo que el titulo original me encanta mas, en todo apartado es igual al original... Lo que cambian son las armas ♥♥♥ las que enfrentaremos a los Xenianos y Soldados. Abra ciertos "puzzles" por decirlo de alguna manera en los que deberemos pensar un poco para pasarlos (nada del otro mundo, pero suma). ¡En resumen esta expansión cumple y ♥♥♥ creces siendo totalmente recomendable para cualquier jugador
 
Fulbito De Uranio
0
20 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
2.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 février 2020
Half-Life: Blue Shift - 3 сценки с Фрименом или спасти свою зaдницу любой ценой.

Так как являюсь фанатом первой и второй части Half-Life, то решил не проходить мимо двух популярных дополнений. То ли "меня подкупил" синий цвет значка, то ли обложка, то ли тот самый охранник, что не мог пройти в дверь, однако из двух дополнений я запустил именно Blue Shift, а в итоге очень зря.

Плюсы:
1. Ландшафт. Начало игры вполне понравилось. Шкафчики охранников, уборная, тир, автоматы с едой и так далее. Не смотря на то, что локации не такого уж и большого размера, но сделано всё вполне удобно и уютно. В дальнейшем прохождении можно заметить, что ящики частенько наполнены амуницией и аптечками, поэтому проблем с патронами или здоровьем явно не будет что на низкой, что на высокой сложностях.

Минусы:
1. "Барни, барни, барни". Неужели настолько было лень вылепить несколько разных моделей? Можно в принципе свихнуться от того, какое количество Барни встречается за игру. Считая одинаковые модели, я сбился примерно на 10-ом Барни, а ведь это не просто какой-то мод, а вполне себе полноценный аддон. Пахнет халтурой.

2. "Барни, купи мне газировку". Игра проходится примерно за час-полтора и процентов 30-40 игры вы будете постоянно слышать: Барни, тебе следует *сделать то*, Барни, *сделай, пожалуйста, это*, Барни, *смотайся туда и сюда*. То вас телепортируют в Зен (даже без костюма HEV, серьезно?), то вам нужно зарядить батарею, то требуется найти определенного ученого. Спасибо, что хоть не заставили убить Нихиланта, а то во Фримене и вовсе бы не было необходимости.

3. "Ну и... Что делать дальше?". Игра до невероятности непредсказуемая. Мало того, что она ломается постоянно (более 2 раз скрипты просто не срабатывали при переходе на новый уровень и приходилось загружаться до других сохранений), так ещё и сидишь и вдупляешь что делать дальше. Не удивляйтесь, если вы будете минут 5-10 подряд бегать туда-сюда и пытаться понять что же в конце концов делать.

4. "И это всё?". Извините за спойлеры, но игра заканчивается на тупейшем: "Всем пока, мы поехали домой". До сих пор не понимаю: так зачем создавалась данная игра? Ради этих 3 сценок, где мы видим Фримена от чужого лица? А что новое-то хоть? Винтовку ввели, модель пистолета новую нарисовали? Мало того, что вырезали большую часть оружий из hl1, так ещё и не добавили НИЧЕГО НОВОГО. Ни врагов, ни оружий, ни новых текстур, ни новых композиций. Нудятина. Мне бы было стыдно такое выпускать.

Итог: не могу даже близко поставить рекомендацию за это. Слишком много убогих скриптов, где враги даже на последней сложности не успевают хотя бы начать стрельбу по вам. Игра осыпает вас патронами и аптечками настолько, что можно зачищать всё только дробовиком и автоматом. Очень короткая, а в конце до такой степени халтурная, что заставляет вас просто стоять и нажимать на кнопку 3 раза с задержкой в 20 секунд. Думаю, тут и без меня понятно, что игру просто начали доить и вышло это недоразумение в виде Blue Shift. Скучное, однообразное, абсолютно ненужное и серое.
 
IMMORTXLZ

MOM
8
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 aout 2021
Half-Life: Blue Shift is the second and last expansion for the original Half-Life. This expansion puts you in the role of a Black Mesa Facility Guard, Barney Calhoun who is also as late for work as Gordon Freeman, but escapes first out of the three main protagonists just after Gordon gets captured by 2 HECU grunts.

"We made it, Mr. Calhoun. We made it." - Dr. Rosenberg

Pros:
- More Half Life content
- At the very beginning you can see Gordon Freeman being late to work just like you, Barney is. That's a really great small detail
- Seeing the Black Mesa accident from another perspective
- Some new unique characters
- Unique locations (Train Yard for example)
- One new feature, that is you can only pick up armor from bodies or from lockers.
- Soundtrack is really great
- Some puzzles are clever

Neutral:
- Some of the soundtrack from Opposing Force is reused here, I have no problem with that because those are bangers, but could've been something different.
- There is no multiplayer at all, but I think it doesn't really matter as noone would've played it anyways, just like with Opposing Force, it has multiplayer but noone actually plays it, most people are on the original Half-Life's multiplayer.

♥♥♥♥:
- HD models changes weapon models just like in the original, from an MP5 to an M16 for example. Just turn it off, it ruins the art style a bit.
- It's a really damn short expansion, took me below 2 hours to complete.
- Doesn't bring much new things to the Half-Life formula (No new enemy types, no new weapons)

9/10 Well this DLC is fine, there isn't anything new sure, but at the very least it gives you an opportunity to see how the Black Mesa incident folds out from Barney's perspective.

My Reviews About Other Half-Life Games:
Half-Life Review
Half-Life: Opposing Force
Half-Life 2 Review
Half-Life 2: Episode One
Half-Life 2: Episode Two
 
Beggar Soldier

Recommandé
4.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 avril 2014
可以给打99.9分的资料片.

优点有二.
其一:短小精悍.
只要是fps玩家,2-3小时内通关相信完全没问题.以时间轴来说只有HL的三分之一,但是遇到的麻烦事一点也不少.因为短,几乎每一处细节都可以被记住.再加上设计得体的关卡,茶余饭后通上一遍,真是既舒筋又活血.

其二:艰苦朴素.
因为主角只是个保安,所以装备和戈登比真是极其的落后,但是敌人的装备还是那么犀利.在敌阵中步步为营,艰难前进,为了目标而奋斗的主角赢得了人气,使得一个原版里打酱油的角色在续篇里也能出尽风头,可见比起东奔西走做英雄,一个朴素的人民公仆反而是更得民心.

* Nuevos personajes, tales como el Doctor Rossenberg.
* Juego corto pero ♥♥♥ una historia que complementará ♥♥♥ la del universo de Half-Life.
8.9/10

В целом Half-Life: Blue Shift вышла клевой хоть и короткой игрой. Несмотря на этот факт, она лаконично дополнила основную сюжетную линию оригинального Half-Life и еще раз вернутся к знакомому комплексу было так приятно.
 
AleX-NeMMesiD
662 produits enregistrés
2
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
0.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 aout 2021
Bu oyun da Opposing Force’ta olduğu gibi ilk oyunu farklı bir karakterin gözünden yaşamamızı sağlamaktadır. İlk oyundaki tren yolculuğunu hatırlarsanız bir sahnede bir polis memurunun (ya da güvenlik görevlisi) kapıyı zorladığını ancak açamadığını görürüz. İşte bu oyunun ana karakteri olan kişi Black Mesa’da çalışan Barney Calhoun adındaki kişidir.

Blue Shift, güvenlik görevlisi Calhoun’un tesisten kaçma çabasını, bu yolda birlikte çalıştığı araştırma takımı üyelerinin yaşadıklarını konu almaktadır. Half-Life’da ters giden deney sonucu yaşananları benzer, ama farklı bir açıdan göstermektedir.

Gordon Freeman ve Adrian Shephard karakterleri G-Man’in ilgisini çekmeyi başarırken, Barney böyle bir etki yaratmamıştır. Barney ile bir sonraki karşılaşma noktamız Half-Life 2 oyunu olacaktır. Barney, Half -ife 2 oyununun başında Freeman’a yardım edecektir. Kaybettiğimiz levyemizi de bize verecektir ve ileride "see you when I see you" demeyide eksik etmeyecektir.

Bu arada neden Blue Shift'de toplam 0 saatimin olduğunu sorarsanız oyunu Sven Co-Op'da bitirmiştimde ondan böyle oldu.
 
MasterSlenderTR
1,225 produits enregistrés

4.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 décembre 2015
Soyons honnêtes, Blue Shift est un bon cran en dessous de son prédécesseur, Opposing Force. On pourrait se demander par exemple pourquoi toutes les nouveautés introduites dans ce dernier ont disparu (ennemis, armes) ou bien pourquoi le jeu ne se termine-t-il pas en apothéose, avec le boss de rigueur : quelques lacunes qui font que Blue Shift n'atteint pas le génie de ses aînés. Mais rassurez-vous, la nostalgie opére toujours à merveille ! Aussi retrouver l'univers d'Half-Life procure-t-il un plaisir incomparable.

Verdict : 4/5 - Très bon, une valeur sûre !
 
Berserkr
1,100 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
7.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 juillet 2021
Blue Shift is probably the piece of the series that gets the most unfair rap. Sure, it doesn't add a whole slew of new enemies, weapons and levels like Opposing Force does, but I do feel that it's a lot more thematically fitting with the tone of the original in the sense that you're not here to save the world because you're "the only bad enough dude" in a way, you're a rent-a-cop who was going about his daily routine until a disaster of cosmic proportions began at your facility and your best hope is to get out as swiftly as possible.
It's the best you could've made out of a scrapped Dreamcast port, it's as long as it needs to be and it's a lot more consistent in quality than OF, which I do love, but boy does it have it's ups and it's really, really low downs. It does also have the best Xen levels in the series, for what it's worth, and it's overall more than worth a play if you're craving one last piece of HL1 content if you've played the original and OF, and it serves as a neat, brief stop before HL2.

This could ruin they're friendship but luckily in the sequel gordon survives the incident and barney has come to an understanding to gordon that without money there is no beer and they're friendship is reunited once again.

10/10 game heartfelt touching story and decent level design i guess

Recommandé
3.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 janvier 2017
Half Life: Blue Shift, like Half Life: Opposing Force, is another perspective to the Black Mesa Incident where you play as a security guard for Black Mesa who's name is Barney Calhoun.

The game is really, really short. My playthrough was about 3 hours but I guess it makes sense since this game was originally an expansion. It has good level design but I'm disappointed that it didn't introduce new weapons like Opposing Force did, or even have any of the new weapons from Opposing Force. Also it didn't have any of the Race X aliens.

Another thing I was disappointed about was that there wasn't a G-Man ending but I guess G-Man isn't going to be interested with everyone.

I'd give this game a nice 8/10 even if it was a bit too short.

Évaluation publiée le 8 décembre 2022
半条命蓝色沸点蓝翔
是半条命以及它的两部资料片中最短的一部，也是武器最少的一部（没有了针锋相对和原作中的高科技武器）
这一部我们操控警卫巴尼，带着众多科学家逃出黑山基地
游戏年代久远还是有bug存在的，在你救出科学家一起前往老实验室时，他有可能会往回跑，按E也无法让他回头（似乎到了某个特定的位置就停下了）
如果想要购入的话建议在优惠期间购买V社大包，里面的求生之路，传送门就足以让你回本

5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 janvier 2015
В этой части half life мы играем охраником Барни Калхауном.
После того,как произошла катастрофа в Чёрной Мезе,всё начало рушится и наша главная цель выбраться из комплекса.
В игре по сути,новых врагов и оружий нет,все те же из первой части.Но есть головоломки в которых придётся подумать.
Сама игра короткая но вполне интересная.Так что советую поиграть как фанату half life.
 
marchena
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
35.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 décembre 2015
A game that has grown on me over time as one of my favorites of all time. It's the shortest expansion pack of the two for HL1, but that doesn't fully undermine its quality - like its vast improvements to the Xen levels (what Opposing Force did as well) in terms of navigation, level design, and user-friendliness.

The story is also engaging (and arguably more relatable given Calhoun's more standard job and role in the Resonance Cascade) and does well at tying in key moments/references from HL1 and Opposing Force. All in all, Blue Shift is still worth your time despite its brief duration, absence of multiplayer, no boss battles, and lack of replay value compared to its predecessors.
 
headcrab69

#BLUESHIFTSWEEP
 
ITrashman115
130 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 avril 2020
Tercer juego de la saga, después de Half-life 1 y opposing force el cual pese a ser corto, no me ha defraudado lo más mínimo. Se tardan unas 5 horas en jugarlo si vas lento y en modo difícil además de las veces que tengas que reiniciar el guardado por los bugs, porque hay bastantes. El modo difícil es realmente complicado la primera mitad del juego porque literalmente vas rapiñando balas hasta el punto que hay enemigos que te los tienes que saltar porque no te queda munición. Por otra parte como es lógico se entienden las limitaciones físicas que se tenía en el momento de forma que los gráficos sean un poco dañinos para la vista. Es realmente gratificante que no tengas que quitar el juego cada media hora por los dolores de cabeza que daban los toros títulos. En cuanto a los puzzles he de decir que la mayoría son mediocres y que hay muchos que están desaprovechados. Además no hay nuevas armas como en el opposing force lo que no lo hace tan disfrutable. La historia se narra muy bien, haciendo que te puedas sentir en la piel de Barney.

Pros
-Barato
-Buena narración
-No hay dolores de cabeza
-Buena jugabilidad
-Buena dificultad

Contras:
-Muchos bugs
-Puzzles desaprovechados
-Corto
-Puede que no te gusten los gráficos

5.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 février 2021
游戏质量还算可以，但比起本体差得有些远。没有字幕差评，语音是全英文的，但是偶尔会蹦出句中文，就很违和。武器种类少得可怜，有时候就很难受，比如火车站那里有个地方会无限刷军队，困难难度下榴弹打光了，靠手雷，刮痧步枪以及炸药根本压制不住，只能硬着头皮冲然后被前后夹击，没有绊雷太难受了。比起其他作短得多的流程内出现了更频繁的BUG，还以为我太菜卡关了，一看攻略是出BUG了。其他的就属于正常水平了，游戏的包打折不贵，可以顺手+1，如果想玩下去的话建议配合攻略食用。

One of the shortest games in the half life series, but just as good as the rest. While it's more underwhelming than Opposing Force and base Half Life, it still has its own charm. I like the layouts of the puzzles as well.

Recommandé
2.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 aout 2018
Half-life'da Gordon, Opposing Force'ta Shephard olarak oynamıştık, bu oyunda onlarla aynı zaman diliminde geçiyor ve bu sefer Barney Calhoun isimli bir güvenlik görevlisini oynamaktayız. Bu oyun diğer iki oyundan farklı olarak puzzle öğelerine daha çok yer veriyor, en azından bana öyle geldi. Böyle dedim diye çatışma ve aksiyon yok sanmayın sakın çünkü yine levyemizi silahımızı kuşanıp olaylara dalıyoruz. Biraz hikayesinden söz etmek gerekirse Black Mesa'ya ilk oyunda geldiğimiz gibi tramvayla (idk what its that called) geliyoruz fakat bir kaç teknik sorunla karşılaşıyoruz kapılar ve bilgisayarlar düzgün çalışmıyor, patlamalar ve kesintiler oluyor. Suç gordonun olduğu takıma atılıyor. Bir süre sonra işler rayından çıkıyor ve kendimizi uzaylılar ve shephardın çalıştığı özel timin arasında buluyoruz.(Bundan sonrası spoiler)
--------------------------------
Bir doktor bize buradan çıkmanın tek yolunun kanallar olduğunu söylüyor ve kanallara doğru yola çıkıyoruz ve başarısız oluyoruz farklı bir doktor black mesa'dan kaçmanın tek yolunun Dr. Rosenberg ile birlikte çalışmak olduğunu söylüyor ve doktoru aramaya başlıyoruz. Doktoru bulduktan sonra diğer doktorlarla buluşup Teleport üzerinde çalışıyoruz daha çok bize amelelik işlerini kitliyorlar ve en sonunda tesisten kaçıyoruz.

Sonu diğer oyunlarından (Half-life ve Opposing force'tan) çok farklı çünkü ilk defa bu oyunda hiç G-man'e bulaşmadan tesiste diğer 3 doktorla birlikte başarıyla kaçıyoruz. Bu arada Calhoun ismini ilerde duyacaksınız benden söylemesi..
Ek olarak Gordonu ve gmani oyun içinde görüyoruz ve bir ara askerlerin shephard hakkında konuştuklarını duyuyoruz.

Half-life evrenini daha iyi anlamak ve öğrenmek istiyorsanız kesinlikle göz atmanızı tavsiye ederim, hiç sıkmıyor :)
 
Canbo
221 produits enregistrés
0

4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
26.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 juin 2016
My personal favorite of the Half-Life Expansions.

You play Barney the security guard, just going through your normal routines. Helping scientists with degrees in theoretical physics and years of experience push an Elevator button. Unfortunately for you, that button somehow ♥♥♥♥♥ everything up, and aliens invade Black Mesa, killing all.

It's much shorter than the first, or even Opposing force, but in a way, it feels much more unique. Give it a try, I'm sure you'll be pleasantly surprised.

1,289 produits enregistrés

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
0.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 septembre 2017
HALF-LIFE: BLUE SHIFT<

The third installment in the half-life series is once again the progeny of valve teaming with gearbox. It brought fewer new elements into the game than the previous two and wasn't well acclaimed by fans. The game upon release on steam suffers from bugs caused by the engine changing and various other things. The game was also originally supposed to be an exclusive for the doomed Sega Dreamcast. The plot takes place during the events of half-life and Instead of playing as gordon freeman, you play as the ordinary watchman Barney Calhoun(the one you see banging on the door in the beginning of half-life). The story also features some new faces not yet seen in the series.

PROS:
-The story is very well paced and put together very nicely. You play as Barney Calhoun during the cascade and cover up operation in black mesa. Not spoiling the rest in case you haven't picked up a copy in the 20 years its existed.
-The environment is very immersive as it is a long seamless road to the end of the game with, as the definition of seamless implies, zero cutscenes or immersion breaking interruptions.
-The gunplay involves the same weapons from half-life with no new additions. The arsenal available is pleasently loud, very powerful feeling, and quite fun to use when eliminating the enemy.
-The ending is great for what it is
-Has an HD reskin to give a fresh coat of paint.

♥♥♥♥: (Not even half-life is safe from sin, sorry) Please note that i am extremely aware that this game is an oldy.
-Controls feel floaty and thats not very great to say when this game is a puzzle platformer.
-Same issues as the original, guns feel not very effective at some times and very effective at others. No idea whats going on here but it hasn't deterred me from playing.
-Unlike the other half-life games before this one, this installment is the buggiest out of the bunch. Plentiful missed triggers and some doors not opening like they should all throughout the entirety of the game. Buy at ones own risk.

This game isn't a must have unlike the original but usually it comes bundled with it so give it a play(used to come free). I picked the entire series up in a frantic buy in a summer sale and it was worth it. if anything it's textures for gmod if you don't have much interest in it. With the bugs still not being fixed to this very day we have the second lowest score out of all half-life games that i'll be giving out.

6 blue vests out of 10

Normally i'd say Decay is up next but i've run into a snag...it's not on steam.

The game is very much available elsewhere but hasn't had an offical release on steam. Only thing i can do is go overtime on this one and plant my review here. DOUBLE REVIEW.

*clears throat*

HALF-LIFE: DECAY<

The fourth installment in the half-life series is once again the progeny of valve teaming with gearbox. It brought a handful of new elements into the game than the previous three with one being a choice of a protagonist. The game was never released on steam and still to this day is a playstation 2 exclusive minus the couple of ports to the PC. The plot takes place prior/during the events of half-life and Instead of playing as gordon freeman, you play as a pair of gordon freeman's colleagues. The story also features some new faces not yet seen in the series.

Being that this game is a platform exclusive i have not played it. My review here is based on the combine overwiki and gameplay footage.

PROS:
-The story is very well paced and put together very nicely. You play as either Gena Cross or Colette Green during the cascade and cover up operation in black mesa. Not spoiling the rest in case you haven't picked up a copy in the 20 years its existed.
-The environment is very immersive as it is a long seamless road to the end of the game with, as the definition of seamless implies, zero cutscenes or immersion breaking interruptions.
-The gunplay involves the same weapons from half-life with no new additions. The arsenal available is pleasently loud, very powerful feeling, and quite fun to use when eliminating the enemy.
-The ending is great for what it is

♥♥♥♥: (Not even half-life is safe from sin, sorry) Please note that i am extremely aware that this game is an oldy.
-Controls feel floaty and thats not very great to say when this game is a puzzle platformer.

This game isn't on steam as i've said before so you can't purchace it. Decay is available as an unoffical port elsewhere to download by the various european/eukrainian developers that made it so. Watch out for fishy links and enjoy.

8 test samples out of 10

Next is Half-life: Source......ugh.
 
eliteblade46
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 aout 2022
Half Life Blue Shift is the second main expansion to Half Life. This part of the HL1 saga puts you in the shoes of Barney Calhoun, everyone's favorite Black Mesa security guard who plays a more prominent role as one of the loveable characters of Half Life 2 in that game. But this expansion is a bit of a step down compared to Opposing force. It's still a very solid expansion, but worse nontheless. The role of a security guard is a less interesting perspective than the previous two, and there aren't really any new weapons or enemies introduced. Towards the end of the campaign you also visit Xen, but it's a lot more bearable than in the first game because it removes a lot of the annoying platforming. Despite some of the obvious similarities, it maintains the amazing worldbuilding, atmosphere, puzzles, and music that you can expect in a Half Life game. So if you're a fan of classic goldsource Half Life games then this should provide a short and sweet little taste of that for you, that I can easily reccommend to FPS fans.
 
Uman Bean
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
5.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 avril 2021
En esta última expansión vemos como fue el incidente de Black Mesa desde los ojos de un guardia de seguridad llamado Barney Calhoun.
Esta expansión no me gustó tanto como Opposing Force debido a que es más corta de duración, se utilizan pocas armas, está el mismo problema ♥♥♥ el doblaje al español (pero es muy leve el problema), la IA es todavía es tonta y no trae casi nada nuevo exceptuando la mecánica de la armadura. El problema de esto se debe en parte que Opposing Forces dejó muy alto el nivel de contenido. ¿Por qué me gustó de igual forma? Me gustó porque tiene la esencia de Half-Life 1, agrega un personaje nuevo que va a tener importancia en las futuras entregas y porque me divertí bastante.
Los puntos positivos son que la acción es muy buena y los puzzles también.
Si tienes un problema ♥♥♥ el mouse al principio es debido a una opción activada por el juego desde el inicio. Para desactivar esa opción tienes que ir a opciones- ratón o mouse y desactiva la opción llamada "Raw mouse imput".
Esta expansión estuvo buena.

daz

Recommandé
12.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 décembre 2017
Segunda expansión de Half Life. La historia se centra en un guardia de seguridad llamado Barney Calhoun. Su tarea: comprobar que no hay ninguna incidencia en las instalaciones de Black Mesa.

En esta expansión, no tendremos traje de protección ya que usamos un casco y chaleco antibalas.

En armamento tendremos las mismas armas que usamos en Half-Life, excepto algunas que no salen.

La duración es muy corta, se puede pasar en 2 horas y media dependiendo de lo difícil que te resulte.

Recomiendo esta expansión, aunque mejor en ofertas ya que su precio a día de hoy es mucho menor.
 
Rubenjackson

6.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 juillet 2023
While not as content rich as Opposing Force, featuring pretty much your boiler plate Half-Life shooting mechanics, and rarely a few heavily scripted npcs to escort, i am of the opinion that Blue Shift contains some of the most tightly designed and atmospheric levels in the whole HL1 Trilogy. Short and sweet, but largely forgettable. If you want more Half-Life, this one scratches the itch as well.

Non recommandé
4.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 mai 2017
It's not really that it's bad, it's jsut mediocre. The game sounds good in theory, but the gameplay is repetative (puzzle, bombarded by cheap wave of enemies, repeat.) Also the game crashed a couple times, and there are some parts where you fall somewhere and need to use noclip to get out (like in between a train car and the wall). The weapons are the same ones as in Half Life, unlike in Opposing Force where you got a bunch of new ones, which makes it a little more boring. It might sound like these make the game bad, but i would really give it a 5/10. I'm only rating down because there's no "meh" option. Keep in mind i'm on mac, so it's probably a little buggier with the crashing and stuff.
 
Ibn Mattuta
1
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 aout 2020
I went into this game expecting it to be the worst of the original Half-Life games, and in a few ways it is, but it's still a good time.

It lacks weapon and enemy variety, and the levels and environments aren't as inventive as the original game or Opposing Force, but the overall quality is still fairly high. It's a more consistent experience than either of those games, and it has a lot of charm. There's a little bit more humour, and the notion of the plucky underdogs of the Black Mesa incident (the pacifist scientists and the usually incompetent and poorly trained security guards) managing to get through by working together makes a welcome change from being Freeman who becomes a well-known hero over the course of the first game, or just Shepherd, a generic soldier in OpFor.

It's a short game, but worth your time if you're a fan of the original and want to round out the experience.
 
Snorbuckle
473 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 juillet 2018
Antes de comenzar quería avisar que soy un "Mentor" y agradecería que me siguieras, hago criticas extensas(Hay casos en los que no, por razones especificas), verdaderas y solo analizo juegos que les haya dedicado tiempo.

Half-Life: Blue Shift:
Es entendible el porque por muchas personas lo consideran la peor "expansión" de "HL", no trae muchas cinematicas donde se pueda ver a Freeman, contamos ♥♥♥ un arsenal mucho mas reducido y limitado (No incorpora ningún arma nueva siquiera), al igual que la duración del juego es muy corta (Comparable ♥♥♥ "HL: Decay) y ni siquiera la historia le salva. Quería agregar que muchos se quejan de que no hay un "boss final", pero no es necesario, teniendo en cuenta que no somos usados por G-Man(Me refiero que Shepard fue usado y Gordon tambien para acabar ♥♥♥ los aliens, pero Shepard falla y se lo deja en "retencíon"), solo queremos escapar del lugar y es lo que logramos.

Caracteristicas:El gameplay en esta expansion trata de escapar de Black Mesa(Como la mayoría de los anteriores), pero en este caso contamos ♥♥♥ la ayuda y trabajamos directamente ♥♥♥ los cientificos/resto de los trabajadores, debemos enfrentarnos a los militares para liberar al Dr.Rosenberg(Suceden cosas anteriores a esto, pero se podria decir que este hecho resalta), dicho "come-libros", había elaborado un plan ♥♥♥ otros compañeros, para poder huir del lugar.
Una vez liberado, nos llevara a través de los laboratorio prototipo, para llegar donde prepararian un teletransportador que los llevaría lejos del lugar. Hay dos "mini-puzzles" antes de llegar, primero debemos viajar al Xen, para activar unos cristales que le dan energía y luego necesitamos una batería para que puedan escapar, usando el teletransportador.
Este junto al HL:Decay es la unica expansión ♥♥♥ un final realmente bueno.

Barney, Gordon y Shepard:
Hablare de los finales (Solo en relacion al primer HL), donde a Barney, en su resumen textual se lo identifica como "fuera de rango"(Lo que apoya mi idea de que G-Man no tenía interes en él), Gordon fue identificado como "Contratado"(G-Man siempre estubo interesado en él y le contrata, además, Gordon mato al Nihilant, ayudando al hombre-g y ♥♥♥ los posteriores hechos) y Shepard identificado como "Retenido"(En este caso G-Man desde un principio incluso cuando estaba entrenando se fijaba en Adrian, para que luego tambien le "encargara" acabar ♥♥♥ el Nihilant, pero falla y lo deja ..."en un lugar que no hieras, ni te puedan herir"...) no me extrañaría que este personaje apareciera en algun HL futuro, por lo que sucede al final del HLOF

Conclusión¿Es el mas "vago" de las expansiones? sí!, ¿Es el peor? No!. Nos termina de atar algunos cabos, le agrega contenido a la trama/historia y Barney es un personaje muy importante en las secuelas. Al igual que podría serlo Shepard, algun día... Pts:7

Guía de gran ayuda:
Traducción "Half-Life: Blue Shift" Español 100% Textos y voces 
Un guide pour Half-Life: Blue Shift
Par : Raskaipika
Esta guía permite traducir la expansión "Half-Life: Blue Shift" al castellano de España, incluyendo textos y voces. Los archivos necesarios para traducir el juego, los he obtenido de mi juego original en...

Recommandé
27.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 juin 2017
total rating 9.5/10

I just replayed Blue SHift in honor of its 16 year anniversary. it has its ups and downs, but its all in all a very fun, quick little expansion to the HL universe.

for the time it was made, gameplay is awesome, with almost no glitches. (3 total. 1, sometimes in order to reload you have to shot, change weapons or reload. 2, one time my crowbar wouldnt stop swinging unless i changed weapons. and 3, once i followed a scientist instead of doing what he told me to do. i got stuck and couldnt move, so i had to reload)

the "puzzles" are decent, challenging(but not too much). flow of plotline is good. it makes you realize just how many heroes there really were that day, not just Freeman(while most others didnt have to face as much as him), and if Barney Calhoun wasnt there, the future of the HL universe would be uncertain.
on that note, the plot is short. not sure how to expand it much, but a bit more could have been nice.

the reason it only gets 9.5/10 is because if the annoyance of the reload glitch, and the fact of how short it is.
 
Petrichor

Création de la communauté pour Half-Life: Blue Shift
Par : chasingEcho

You are a security guard at a facility that summons aliens and devastation due to scientists playing God. So get in there in this enjoyable FPS and save the day.
Summary
Come the moment, come the man: Barney's band of brothers in blue gets the job done.
Pros:
- old skool gameplay
- everyone loves Barney
- a nice take on Half-Life

♥♥♥♥:
- its difficult to remember any standout design moments
- not as good as the Dreamcast version
7/10 - GOOD

boyflea

4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 juin 2018
λ Badass Barney λ

Blue Shift to wydany w 2001 roku drugi oficjalny dodatek do gry Half Life.

Fabuła (uwaga spoilery):
Powracamy do ośrodka badawczego Black Mesa. Gdy meldujemy sie na posterunku (jeszcze przed eksperymentem Gordona) dowiadujemy sie że wszystko tego dnia ma usterki. Akcja zaczyna sie gdy zmierzając w głąb bazy dochodzi do katastrofy. Na naszych oczach z portali wychodzą obcy i mordują wszystkich dookoła. Podczas ratowania swojego życia dowiadujemy się że jest możliwość ucieczki. W ukrytej części ośrodka znajduję sie eksperymentalny portal. Niestety by z niego skorzystać musimy sie nieźle nasilić. Tak naprawdę wszystko co napotykamy na swojej drodze dobrze znamy z Half-Life'a, tylko oczami naszego drogiego Calhoun'a.

Grafika:
Bardzo podobna jak w Half-Life, z delikatną poprawą. Jak na 2001 rok można by spodziewać się jakiegoś większego polepszenia ale i tak jest bardzo dobrze.

Muzyka:
Bardzo dobrze wpasowana do sytuacji jaka panuje na ekranie. Świetne udźwiękowienie obiektów, pomieszczeń, wrogów oraz broni.

No ale jak w to pykać?
Podobnie jak w poprzednim dodatku gra jest pierwszoosobową strzelanką, a tryb prowadzenia gry nie uległ zmianom. Na naszej drodze spotkamy znanych z „podstawki” wrogów takich jak obcy czy jednostki specjalne HECU. Nasz bohater posiada ograniczony arsenał broni znany z HL. Nie raz musimy wykazać się zdolnością zręcznego poruszania się czy też logicznym myśleniem (łamigłówki). Tak samo jak w częściach poprzednich będziemy napotykać laborantów których będziemy musieli eskortować. Gra jest zdecydowanie krótsza od swoich dwóch poprzedników (około 3 godziny gry).
Bardzo pozytywne odczucia gdy napotykaliśmy Gordona Freemana z sytuacji znanych z HL jak np. przyjazd do pracy, rozmowa widziana przez kamery, pojmanie

… ugi BUGI …?
Brak.

Co wyszło grze na zdrowie:
+ grafika
+ muzyka
+ grywalność
+ fabuła wydarzeń z Half-Life oczami strażnika ochrony

Co szkodzi całości:
- postać ślizga się

Polecana dla tych, którzy lubią:
☑ klasyczne FPS'y o świetnej fabule

꧁Ocena: 8.5/10꧂


➥ Obserwuj mnie jako kuratora :D ⤵
https://store.steampowered.com/curator/32933913/

Recommandé
3.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 juillet 2022
Like the game, this review is short and simple. This game is overall just okay. I don't really have much of a stance on it. i mean it's a DLC following Barney Calhoun and his short journey to help the scientists and himself escape Black Mesa. It happens during Gordon's journey in the first game and makes it clear where you are in relation to Gordon. It's short and doesn't have much story wise. It's main purpose is to answer your question of "what were the scientists and security guards I met along the way doing during all this?" And it does well at explaining that. All the same criticisms I had for HL1 apply here except for difficulty and pacing. Thats why i give it a 6/10.
 
The_Nightwingg
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
40.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 avril 2021
Попытка номер два
Не прошло и трёх лет после выхода Opposing Force, как Gearbox радуют нас очередным дополнением к первой части, в этот раз оно посвящено охраннику Барни, тот самый что в начале оригинала стучал в дверь с фонариком в руках. Дополнение не сыскало любви у фанатов, и в целом получилось сомнительным. Если Opposing Force понравился некоторым фанатам даже больше оригинала, то про Blue Shift такого не скажешь. Так что-же с ним может быть не так? Разберём.

Плюсы
Ну, у этого дополнения своеобразный маппинг, свои мелкие детали и сценки, некоторые из них не похожи на те, что мы видели в прошлых двух дополнениях. Кроме этого, у мода есть эффект, что наш персонаж говорит, но не для нас, поэтому если поговорить с учёными, то они ответят нам "Нет, я не доктор Розенберг", что говорит само за себя. А так, в моде ещё поработали над сложностью, что хорошо может растянуть мод, ох... Никогда не забуду головоломку с бочкой, и как-бы я тогда догадался, что её надо ставить между проводами! Ну, короче, плюсов не особо много, ну есть ещё пара новых моделей, в частности модель самого Розенберга, которая сделана вполне достойно. Ну и на этом список всего хорошего заканчивается...

Минусы
Во-первых дополнение очень короткое, несмотря на сложность, которая увеличивает время геймплея (А я всем рекомендую играть на харде) аддон всё-равно очень короткий, уж его можно легко пройти за день и даже не утомится, чувствуется что только в него внедряешся, а тут он блин, заканчивается! Кроме этого нас заставят тут вернутся обратно в локацию где мы побывали, что не даёт разнообразия в локациях, но является интересным дизайнерским решением, чувствуется, что аддон слишком сырой, хотя концовка порадовала, не только сценой где мы видим Фримена, но и сценой где мы телепортируемся отсюда вместе с учёными, где мы чувствуем напряжение, что пора скорее-бы отсюда сваливать, пока есть время. Ну а так, этот аддон вышел даже короче чем Episode One, но в целом не стоит забывать что это аддон, да и всё-равно видно, что в него вложили свою любовь дизайнеры.

Итог
В целом, дополнение неплохое, не идеальное, но и не совсем провал. Проходить его в очередной раз будет приятно, но думаешь что могло получиться нечто большее, чем это. Ну а так, советую ознакомиться, тем кто не прошёл.

Оценка : 7 батарей для телепорта из 10
 
Bratishka

Non recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 octobre 2020
well this has been a disappointment.
after playing the original half life and opposing force i was expecting another good expansion pack, but this was nothing compared to them, it was short and full of bugs.

characters wouldn't have dialogue when i reloaded a quick save, Dr Rosenburg would barely walk a step before stopping and needing a break, and once he just full on stopped, sometimes i couldn't move when i went back to fix it.

it adds barely any content other than a new character and some new parts of black mesa, and even those are bland in themselves.

it had some annoying puzzles near the end of the game and was much shorter than Opposing Forces.

the good parts were the start and the last endgame part, and of course the credits, because i didn't need to play the game anymore

Recommandé
2.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 juin 2023
Finished this game for the second time in my life so far. After beating two of the expansion packs I gotta to say that I liked this expansion pack more because of how more linear and easier it is compared to opposing force. Yeah it doesn't have all the weapons from the previous game pack and new weapons it's pretty much half life 1.5. You get to play as Barry Calhoun that tries to escape Black Mesa just like the rest of the scientist from this expansion pack. I do like that you can not only pick up armor that are body armor and helmets that are litered out in the game but you can't use the hev armor health thing which makes me think "What's the point of having a HEV suit regen if you can't even use it in the game?" I bet they just put it in the game as a tease for the player. Also the expantion pack is pretty short so you can beat this game with or without guides in under 3 hours.

After finishing this game pack I give this game a 8/10 and I do recommend it to anyone that's curious about the other characters that are part of the Half Life universe.
 
Sillyriver44

4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
4.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 juillet 2020
Gearbox seems to have learnt from the issues from HL and HL:OF. Blue Shift has short but sweet story, includes good level design and gameplay. My major gripe with the original was sometimes the game expecting you have more health, making it difficult to progress through the game, this is far less noticeable here. Overall, this game got it right. A "harder" game isn't a better game, and Blue Shift was challenging enough to make it engaging, and sometimes unforgiving but at a good level. The end I believe was more entertaining, with more ass-clenching, and less grind. Easter eggs were on point and you never really lose the picture of the objective, it feels in your scope and achievable. It took my 4½ hours of casual play, and I'd recommend this one out of the two original Half-Life DLCs if you can't play both.
 
dropcmd

Évaluation publiée le 26 avril 2019
我是一名守卫，我被迫陷入危险之中，但是……我发现只要我子弹够多，我就是无敌的！！！（暴论）因为没字幕所以卡关了很多地方，但还是过了，那么我就把我卡关的位置一一说一下
1.箱子是可以拖动的！也可以推动
2.外场的轮胎可以跳上去
3.铁桶可以导电，不要在化学液里面游泳
4.大桥只能在2楼的那个开关处升起
5.逆变器也可以拖动。
6.是传送3个博士再传送你，不要急

Speed
116 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 février 2023
Half-Life: Blue Shift, Valve tarafından geliştirilen birinci şahıs nişancı oyunu Half-Life'ın resmi bir genişletme paketidir. Orijinal oyunun olay örgüsünden farklı bir bakış açısı sunan Blue Shift, oyunun ana karakteri Gordon Freeman'ın yerine güvenlik görevlisi Barney Calhoun'u kontrol etmenize olanak tanır.

Oyunun hikayesi, Black Mesa Araştırma Tesisleri'nde yaşananların hemen öncesinde başlar. Barney Calhoun, bir güvenlik görevlisi olarak çalışmaktadır ve oyun, Calhoun'un Black Mesa'daki iş gününe odaklanmaktadır. Oyun boyunca, Calhoun, Xen'in yaratıkları ve diğer tehlikelerle savaşarak, Black Mesa'da çıkan kaosa ve olayların neden olduğu kargaşaya tanık olur.

Oynanış açısından, Half-Life: Blue Shift, Half-Life'ın aynı tarzda birinci şahıs nişancı oynanışını benimser. Ancak oyun, oyunun ana karakteri Gordon Freeman'a benzer şekilde, Barney Calhoun'un farklı silahlar kullanmasına, bulmacaları çözmesine ve etkileşime girmesine olanak tanır.

Grafikler ve sesler, Half-Life'ın orijinal oyunundan miras alınmıştır ve oyunun atmosferik ve gergin dünyasına katkıda bulunur. Ayrıca, oyunun yapay zeka düşmanları oldukça zekidir ve oyuncuları taktiksel ve zorlu bir oyun deneyimi sunar.

Genel olarak, Half-Life: Blue Shift, Half-Life evrenine daha derin bir bakış açısı sunan heyecan verici bir genişletme paketidir. Black Mesa'da yaşanan olayların farklı bir perspektiften görülmesine olanak tanıyan oyun, oyun dünyasının güvenlik görevlilerinin nasıl yaşadıklarına dair daha iyi bir anlayış kazandırmaktadır.
 
Ashnazq
3,180 produits enregistrés
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0

Recommandé
7.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 décembre 2015
This game is really good, much better than Opposing Force. Gone are the stupid weapons and enemies and back are the really good ones from the original. The first half of the game the quality of the mapping is about the same as Opposing Force’s, but in the second half it does get a lot better. There is also a considerably better flow and story compared to Opposing Force, here there actually is one compared to the no existent one in Opposing Force.

There are no reused sections, although some did seem to take a lot of inspiration from Half-Life’s. However there is a heavy use of sections where you need to go a long way around just to open a door, this is done multiple times. Also not all the weapons are used, this is a good thing is some ways since everything in this game was not out of place, but there are still some non-energy\Xen weapons that are not used.

The main problem with the game is that is it too short, it really does feel like they made half the game, then ran out of time. This would explain the lake of weapons and also the lack of difficulty increase, there is no end boss and the end point does feel like a mid-point.

But this game is really good, if you had to choose between this and Opposing Force, choose this. Opposing Force was not that great, this however is really good, in some ways better than Half-Life.
 
Dark Light

Évaluation publiée le 15 octobre 2019
A very short expansion for Half-Life. While it is not as fresh and original as Half-Life: Opposing Force or Half-Life, its still an alright game. None of the encounters are very challenging, no new weapons or enemies and an escort mission that if you walk 10 feet ahead of him, he stops moving. I'd only play/buy it if you are big on the Half-Life experience.

Évaluation publiée le 30 juin 2017
Half-Life: Blue Shift conta a história de Barney Calhoun, um guarda de segurança do Laboratório Black Mesa que sobreviveu aos eventos da Cascata de Ressonância e chegou até HL2 como o personagem Barney.
Blue Shift, embora seja mais curto que Half-Life e Opposing Force, ainda dá um bom tempo de diversão, com sua história interessante e jogabilidade emocionante. Cada segundo do jogo é recheado de perigo, seguindo fielmente a promessa de Half-Life.
 
Nightmare
1
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 novembre 2010
Half-Life was one of the first FPS to propose a complex story, with graphics still angular but with the best 3D for 1998. You were Gordon Freeman, a scientist turned hero for the Black Mesa staff, in a place where an alien invasion was happening, where Marines and Black Ops were the "cleaners". G-Man, mysterious man with a case, was monitoring you.

The game was a real success and an add-on was released in 1999. Opposing Force was shorter than HL (normal for an add-on) but with the return of the G-Man, with new weapons, new enemies. One big difference: you weren't Gordon. No, you were Adrian Shepard, corporal in the HECU, belonging to the famous Marines who were adversaries in HL. You were a Marine now but fortunately, you changed your mind: no more scientists or guards killings, as you can suppose that they'll be an useful help.

HL, HLOF and Blueshift are the three main games of what we can call, now that that Half-Life 2 and Co. are released, the Black Mesa Era. So what is about Blueshift?

The Black Mesa Era is special because of the multiple points of view you can play. Gordon was the scientist side, Adrian the military one, so, it was missing the guard one.

Many can argue that we could have played a Black Ops, a Xenian (the mod Point of View is taking the matter in its hand), the woman that was pushing the crystal (the exclusive mission on PS2, Decay, is taking the matter in its hand, as the mod Decay, a port for PC of this mission) or anything else (a janitor - well, a mod is existing, an external person - the mod Half-Life Visitors is... oh well, you know what I mean). But Gearbox choose what was called Barney, the guards of Black Mesa, taking that name for making an hero. It could have been Otis, it would have been really funny to be healed by donuts.

So, you're returning into Black Mesa Hell. You're Barney Calhoun, a guard, beginning your adventure before the incident triggered by Gordon. Then, eventually, you will have to fight your way in a chaotic facily, trying to escape, finding a certain Rosenberg and... well, it's not a spoiler, Barney did escape Black Mesa, like Gordon and Adrian, apart from the fact that he was still free.

I need to say something: it's a stand-alone, where a lot of gamers tended to call it an add-on.

Story is basic, hell, it's just another day in Black Mesa, so don't expect something different. See the community mod for it. But Gearbox did a crime, an offense in the Half-Life Mythology.

G-Man is appearing once. What? Half-Life 2 Episode One did the same? Hey, the story was about saving Gordon from him. But G-Man did come back in the next chapter, still following Gordon.

G-Man was interested in Gordon and Adrian. But not in Barney Calhoun, who is in the Combine Era one of the most famous Resistance leader. G-Man was involved with Eli and Alyx Vance's story. Why not with Barney, who is one of the few that were really struggling. Where is my fun to spot G-Man?

Gameplay hadn't change a bit and I don't complain about that: it's Half-Life, I mean, you have to climb ladders, find a way to kill enemies when your weapons aren't sufficient, you have to be careful when nearing toxic areas and when you're jumping on Xen...

The game had a big bug, meaning that you're obliged to download a patch: Flashlight wasn't working. Other negative point is that you can't use the HEV device for protection... in total contradiction with Adrian Shepard, not belonging to Black Mesa, who can use it! Also, BlueShift didn't solve the problems of these dangerous ladders when it comes to climb down.

Graphics are still the same if you don't install the High Definition Pack. If you do so, the HDP is making the characters less angular, your environment is less sterile and a new skin is given to your weapons. Anyway, Blue Shift's graphics are good if you're not allergic to "old" engines.

With an established universe like Half-Life, Blue Shift couldn't forget to make some references to the two previous games: you see Gordon in his tramway when you're trying to enter to your department for work (a scene present in the original Half-Life) or just before he's entering in it. You're seeing him in the Sector C, walking to his destiny, you're seeing the famous crystal that will triggered the portals being carried to its final destination and last but not least, the professor you're rescuing is thinking that Gordon will not solve things, that it's a foolish idea to believe in him. Oh, have I mentioned that the last you'll be seeing Gordon is when he's captured by the Marines? Next time, it would be years later, in City 17 train station. Well, Blue Shift is taking place at the same time of the first part of Gordon's story, so, it's normal to have a lot of references to Half-Life. For Opposing Force, the only mention of Adrian Shepard is made by a Marine when throwing Otis, the fat guard, in a pit you're climbing.

Blueshift is really lacking of novelties. It isn't bringing something new besides the story. Barney only uses Half-Life's weapons (no Opposing Force did make it) and worst of it, he has less than Gordon. No more experimental weapon, no more crossbow. Then, the enemies are reduced to what Gordon encountered (less the giant boss like Gargantua), so, no Race X from Opposing Force. And last but not the least (for me), soundtrack is good but isn't renewed like in Opposing Force. No new tunes, no new sounds, well, it's kind of frustrating for me who loves soundtrack, particularly when a game set in an universe has a different music than the others.


Finally, Blue Shift, for a stand-alone, is shorter than the add-on Opposing Force... who was shorter than Half-Life. Five hours of playing (and more if your flashing is buggy) isn't enough for Half-Life. Well, the episodic games set in HL2 universe are as short as Blue Shift but the content is more extended than Blue Shift's. Here, we're in 2001, players were waiting for HL2 and well, they're in the right to expect much more for HL. It was like the game was rushed for giving something to impatient fans.
 
Vic=HKC=
2,738 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0

Évaluation publiée le 29 juin 2017
It's like half-life one but you're not gordon freeman. If you already have this game, or if it's less than a dollar, and you've played half life one, then recommended. It's highly amusing to see the references to what was going on during the whole time while freeman is doing freeman things. 11/10

If you didn't play half life one, then don't bother playing this, it'll just be like any other old clunky fps with bullet sponge enemies and a magnum handgun that hits harder than a combat shotgun. Unless that's your gig of course, then go right on ahead.

Recommandé
3.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 février 2020
Blue Shift happens at the same time with the adventure of Gordon in Half-Life, talking about a group of scientists and a guard trying to save themselves after sh*it blew up in Black Mesa. The story is very straightforward, not much plots. I think one reason Blue Shift is developed is Valve wanted to build a foundation of the story in Half-Life 2, which I haven't played yet.

Compared to Half-Life and Opposing Force, I think the graphics of the game is enhanced, though many scenes are too dark even I have adjusted the brightness to maximum, making me feel uncomfortable. The atmosphere is enhanced, too. It is spooky and finally brings a sense of horror that I did not feel in the previous two games. I enjoyed it a lot. Unfortunately, the game is too short. I was expecting six hours playtime like Opposing Force, yet it only has three hours. It feels like the show is already over when the best of it just begins.

0
Recommandé
4.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 mai 2018
Comprei esse jogo lá em 20/06/2014, mas o que a focda estou somente a jogar quase 4 anos depois? Platinei a saga do Half Life toda, fui jogar as expansões Blue Shift e Opposing Force, eu iniciava o jogo e a resolução ficava muito alta, impossibilitando escolher quaisquer opção, como as configurações de alterar tamanho de tela. E então só em 2017, com mais de 3 mil hora de Left 4 Dead 2, que descobri as opções de inicialização Steam, cujo pode configurar a forçar o jogo a a rodar em 'x' idioma, em 'y' resolução! Aí eu configurei pra rodar numa resolução maior, mas a preguiça não deixou eu abri o jogo, viciado em Team Fortress 2, excluí o jogo. E então no ano do Hexa, eu finalmente zerei esse jogo de ótima qualidade cujo um Guarda buscar o protagonista de outro jogo, pois lhe deve uma cerveja trincado meu consagrado
 
bea
1,136 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 novembre 2019
입대하자마자 최전방 현역으로 활동하는 칼훈의 대 모험!!
* 마우스를 사용하고싶다면 마우스 옵션에서 raw mouse input을 켜야한다.

1. 출시년도다운 그래픽
- NPC 이동시의 계단현상, 랜턴의 답답한 시야, 이게 스위치인지 포스터인지 구분해내는 간단한 눈썰미 테스트 등
2. 출시년도다운 서라운드
- 사방팔방 너무나 확실한 소리의 단계적 위치, 렉걸린줄 알았던 공간계 이펙트
3. 출시년도다운 부분 음성지원
- 아주 잘하셨습니다. 메뉴만 한글인줄 알았더니 음성까지 한글지원이 되는줄 전혀 모르겠군요!
4. 불친절한 퍼즐
- 하프라이프식 뜬금없이 퍼즐을 풀어야 진행할 수 있는데 이 수준이 알바하면서 밥먹다가 사장님께 불려나가는 수준.
- 하프라이프 특유의 구린 조작감으로 인한 스트레스는 덤

하지만 스토리에서 나름 비중이 없지는 않으니 하프라이프 팬이라면 꼭 플레이하기를 권장한다.
 
HaRang

Pixie
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 septembre 2016
Второе официальное дополнение к первому Half-Life, и по-моему мнению - самое неудачное.
В этот раз, разработчики из Gearbox решили не заморачиваться и не придумывать новое оружие и врагов.
Игра имеет очень короткую по сравнению с Opposing Force продолжительность.
Blue Shift - это фактически пересказ оригинального Half-Life: те же текстуры, те же сюжетные повороты.
Даже конец игры напоминает уровень "Ядро Лямбды" из оригинала 1998 года.

Поставить палец в низ - не дают лишь детские воспоминая и то, что это дополнение было первым в которое я поиграл.
 
ЕР
1,085 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 décembre 2022
Краще, ніж очікував, а проте - коротко.

Плюси:
1) Цікавий сюжет, що розповідає історію одного з важливих персонажів для сюжету HL2. Проходити обов'язково.
2) Грати було цікаво

Недоліки:
1) Коротко, хотілось б трохи побільше, але з іншої сторони гра недорога, і чудово розповідає історію
2) У перших галф лайфах дуже легко заплутатись із проходженням xd

Непоганий продукт, якщо маєте 2 вільних годинки на день, за 2 вечора пройдете.
 
CrazyBee
56 produits enregistrés
0
13 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 novembre 2014
Ох, рано встает охрана

Half-Life: Blue Shift является еще одним аддоном к HL.

Здесь мы побываем в шкуре обычного охранника Барни у которого день точно не задался.
То дверь заела, то с лифтом беда, а еще этот каскадный резонанс... Барни оказался не в том месте, не в то время. Чтож, остается только взять себя в руки и пытаться выжить.

В общем и целом, HLBS представляет собой куцый аддон, который легко "пробегается" за 4 часа.

Как говорится: "Вкусновато, но маловато!"

7 пончиков из 10.

И снова давай, по новой
Та же история и новое действующее лицо,
Теперь Калхоун, охранник второго плана,
И его история спасения учёных и себя.
Головоломки теперь более нерешаемы,
Проблемы с запуском игры отсутствуют.
Менее насыщенное DLC, чем HL:OF, но,
Всё равно стоит внимания и твоего времени

2.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 novembre 2021
i think this only has value if you are a fan of Half-Life, this is just more Half-Life 1, its diet coke Half-Life 1, the game has none of the weapons added in Opposing Force, in fact it has 3 less than base Half-Life 1, there are more graphical/sound glitches for some reason, there are far less set pieces and much less interesting ones, and the thing never escalates, im pretty sure i killed like 3 Alien Grunts total in the entire game, i didnt even use the rocket launcher once because it was honestly overkill

Spoilers:

you know what the final fight was? 2 houndeyes and like 5 HECU Marines

man, this game is EASY, and short, took me less than 3 hours to finish, also padded towards the end

basically, you buy this to shoot a bit more with HL1 mechanics and to get a little bit more of the story of Half-Life, and to its credit, the game accomplishes that
 
Nuclear Kangaroo
1,298 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
6.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 mars 2020
Playing Half Life after 18 years!
WOW what a fitting sequel in making the trilogy!
I found this game to be slightly scarier than opposing force and original Half LIfe!

..Because you're playing as Barney lol, he's a security guard, unlike being a theoretical physicist or a marine, imagine being in the shoes of a naive gullible security guard and watching his whole life just change!
What can he do to live through this nightmare? ...is what Blue shift accurately conveys.
The sequels aren't supposed to overshadow the originals anyway, so I dont understand why this got less acclaim?

10/10 if you are a big fan of the franchise should not miss this subtle masterpiece!

Évaluation publiée le 22 mars 2016
The best feature about this DLC is you get to play as Barney Calhoun. You know, the guy from Half Life 2. And you play from his perspective to escape Black Mesa. Other than that, there isn't much to say. Except that this DLC is the shortest in the original Half Life I've played; It took me a little under 4 hours to play through from start to finish, as oppose to Opposing Force that took me 5 hours to complete.

Half Life: Blue Shift gets a 7/10. I would get it when it goes on sale.

See you on the next review. ~Stealth 1548

2.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 février 2015
Дополнение к Half-Life позволяет играть за знаменитого охранника Барни. По ходу повествования мы встречаем старых знакомых Гмана, Гордона и других, что меня очень порадовало. В игре приходится не только стрелять, но и разгадывать различные загадки. Меня удивило, что разработчики не сделали новых видов оружия и врагов.

Игра, кстати, проходится очень быстро. У меня это заняло всего два часа. После прохождения остаются только приятные впечатления.

vincendio
1,478 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
0.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 septembre 2023
Half-Life: Blue Shift İncelemesi:

Grafikler (7/10): 🌆🎮 Half-Life: Blue Shift, Half-Life'ın grafik motorunu kullanır ve o dönem için oldukça iyi görünen bir oyun sunar. Ancak, günümüz standartlarına kıyasla grafikler daha basit görünebilir.

Oynanış (8/10): 🕹️🔫 Oyun mekaniği, Half-Life serisine özgüdür ve oyunculara çeşitli bulmacaları çözme ve düşmanlarla savaşma fırsatı sunar. Oynanış hala eğlenceli ve tatmin edicidir.

Hikaye (7/10): 📖🚀 Blue Shift, Half-Life evreninde geçer ve diğer oyunların olaylarını farklı bir perspektiften anlatır. Ancak, hikaye biraz sınırlıdır ve derinlikten yoksun olabilir.

Atmosfer (8/10): 🌃🌟 Oyun, Half-Life evreninin karakteristik atmosferini yansıtır. Black Mesa Araştırma Tesisi'nin karmaşıklığı ve gizemi oyunculara aktarılır.

Özgünlük (7/10): 🌟🔬 Blue Shift, Half-Life serisine sadık kalır ve aynı temel yapıya sahiptir. Ancak, farklı bir karakterin gözünden hikayeyi anlatarak bazı yeni öğeler ekler.

Sonuç olarak, Half-Life: Blue Shift, serinin bir parçası olarak keyifli bir deneyim sunar. Grafikler o dönem için iyiydi, oynanış eğlenceliydi ve atmosfer klasiktir. Ancak, hikaye açısından bazı sınırlılıklar bulunabilir. Half-Life hayranları için ilginç olabilir. 🪐🔫

Esta expansion aporta en el lore de la saga pero no agrega contenido nuevo, la expansión opposing force podrá tener cosas negativas pero decidieron arriesgarse y agregar contenido nuevo, mientras que Blue shift se va a lo seguro, las 2 expansiónes me gustan y los recomiendo por diferentes razones, pero como dije antes Blue shift tiene una historia mejor y que si aporta pero solo tiene contenido ya usado en half life 1, pero es buena expansión, lo recomiendo.

0
Recommandé
2.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 mai 2022
This game expands upon Half-Life's story, having you play as a Black Mesa security guard. Overall, it's more Half-Life, which is always a good thing, but it does get a bit boring in some parts. However, the game's short, so it doesn't overstay its welcome. It's worth a playthrough if you love Half-Life and want to get a bit more out of the franchise. You also get to learn how the teleporting works which is a fun little bit of lore.
 
Strange Hero
578 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 février 2022
8/10. Blue Shift es una expansión buena y entretenida pero no te esperes que sea como Opposing Force además de que la duración de esta expansión es muy corta (1 o 2 horas), opinión más detallada abajo:

Uno de los puntos buenos de la expansión en mi opinión es:

Crossovers ♥♥♥ el Half Life principal y Opposing force:
En esta expansión nosotros estaremos en el punto de vista de un guardia normal de Black Mesa (Barney Calhoun) y momentos como:
Insecurity en el elevador justo cuando sucede la cascada de resonancia
Duty Calls cuando vemos a unos miembros de HECU tirando un cuerpo y hacen mención a Adrian Shephard Y por ultimo cuando en el final (Deliverance) vemos a Gordon Freeman siendo arrastrado por miembros de HECU así conectándose ♥♥♥ el capitulo "Apprehension" del Half Life principal es muy interesante de ver en esta expansión como desde el punto de vista de Barney y más si completaste el Half life principal y Opposing Force.

Es entretenido y tiene puzzles divertidos:[/h1]
Esta expansión te puede llegar a pasar un buen rato ya que se mantiene el Gameplay divertido del Half Life principal y además de que es fácil de entender, esta expansión también es la que incluye más puzzles a comparación de hl1 y Opposing Force, los puzzles son simples de entender ya que tampoco son muy complejos.

Lo que considero lo malo:

Su duración:
Es demasiado corto que llega al punto de sentirse algo decepcionante y además de que sus capitulo de introducción "Living Quarters Outbound" se llega a sentir algo largo y más que en el siguiente capitulo "[Insecurity]" ya quieres entrar a la acción a pasar un buen rato pero eso es hasta ya la mitad del capitulo
(HL1 también tiene 2 capítulos de introducción así pero al menos se perdona porque dura más tiempo)

Cinemáticas a tiempo real que se sienten aburridas:
HL2 también tiene cinemáticas a tiempo real pero ahí llegan a estar interesantes por como se implementan pero en Blue Shift es diferente ya que momentos ♥♥♥ el "Dr. Rosenberg" se llegan a sentir interesantes la 1RA ver pero ya cuando es tu 2DA ver jugando Blue Shift se llega a sentir [/i]tedioso[/i]...

Este es mi primera reseña que hago en Steam espero que les sea útil
 
Umilol18
29 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 décembre 2021
Half-Life: Blue Shift
Alebo pomerne krátke rozšírenie herného zážitku z hry Half-Life. Ak by sme sa bavili o hre novšieho formátu, tak Blue Shift by nebol braný ako samostatná hra, ale skôr ako DLC. Táto recenzia nadväzuje v každom smere, mimo príbehu, na svoju hernú matku práve v podobe prvého Half-Lifu, ktorý by si mal čitateľ zahrať prv. Ovládateľnosť, hrateľnosť, mechaniky dokonalé, grafika na dobu vzniku pohodičke, no a ten spomínaný príbeh (hráme za SBS Black Mesa), ten tu trošku zaostáva spolu s časovou dĺžkou celého Blue Shiftu.

Achievement hunteri: Hra neobsahuje žiadne achievementy.
Pomer cena a zábava: Odporúčam kúpu v zľave.
Celkový dojem z hry: ★★★/5.
 
Indian0

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 septembre 2021
Half-Life: Blue Shift is the final expansion for Half-Life and if you love Half-Life you will love this expansion. The most interesting/fun fact about the expansion for me is that Gearbox (Borderlands) developed it in 2001 under the supervision of Valve which is just a cool piece of history in my mind.

This expansion has some solid combat, enjoyable puzzles, and a good story with a unique perspective. The only knock that I have towards this game/expansion is that it is more Half-Life and in my mind you would think there would be more guns or some gameplay changes to justify it as an expansion.

1,816 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 octobre 2016
Blue Shift, the 2nd of the three Gearbox expansions for Half-Life, re-tells the story of the Black Mesa Incident from Barney Calhoun's perspective. While undeniably short it stays true to the original Half-Life, in my opinion far closer than Opposing Force and Decay, as such if you enjoyed Half-Life you'll likely enjoy Blue Shift.

I'd also like a moment to address those calling this lazy. Specifically complaints about lack of added content. Turn your attention to the High Definition Pack, which initially came with Blue Shift (now implemented in all HL steam releases) which added the option for HD models (found within settings) for each of the PC Half-Life games. Various changes were included, most notably increased polygon count on both character and weapon models. You can read more about this here.[half-life.wikia.com]
 
Dante from Devil May Cry

Recommandé
5.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 aout 2015
Half-Life: Blue Shift, é a segunda expansão de um dos jogos mais premiados da história, Half-Life.
Você assume o controle de um segurança do Black Mesa, Barney Calhoun.

Barney passa por diversos pontos que interligam Half-Life e suas expansões, como o momento em que Gordon pula em um portal para entrar no planeta Xen, ou as diversas misteriosas aparições de G-Man.

Os inimigos são os mesmos do original, porém a expansão conta com algumas armas diferentes.
O jogo é bem menor que o primeiro.

Évaluation publiée le 4 février 2021
Со второй попытки все же Gearbox удалось "почувствовать" Half-Life. По сути Blue Shift даже не ощущается чем-то отдельным, в отличии от Opposing Force, а скорее как сейчас это модно - сюжетное DLC. Более медленный геймплей, лучше левел-дизайн и, главное отличие от OF - лучше сбалансирована сложность. Плюс без багов.
8 из 10.

Recommandé
2.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 octobre 2014
Если бы меня спросили, какая самая слабая часть в серии HL, то я бы несомненно бы назвал Blue Shift, потому что непонятно, для чего этот аддон сделан. Сюжетно он не привносит никаких особых изменении, оружие такое же, как и в оригинальной части, враги оттуда же. По сути, эта та же первая часть (игра так же начинается с поездки на монорельсе), только с другим персонажем, локациями и без боссов (даже в конце). Если же вам, как фанату, хочется посмотреть на новые локации и взглянуть на любимую Чёрную Мезу с другого ракурса - то смело включайте, благо игра проходится за 5 часов, но вот после себя никаких ощущений не оставляет.

6 из 10

Évaluation publiée le 30 janvier 2021
doesn't really matter what people say about the lack of new content.. Its still an enjoyable game that I managed to complete in a 3 hour sitting. They did well with the resources they were given and its not the sort of game that you need to watch a walkthrough to complete. I was never a fan of the HD pack in vanilla Half-Life but it seems to fit alright in Blue Shift.

If you've got $8 to spare, you might as well give it a go, i don't really have anything negative to say about the game.

Évaluation publiée le 13 juin 2018
Half Life from the perspective of a Security Officer.

Blue Shift did some stuff a lot better than OpFor. One of them and the one I especially liked was the bit where you're helping the scientists teleport away. No fighting ...No noise. Some urgency but still a nice change of pace from the usual mindlessness of gunning down everything in your vicinity. Hell, sometimes you'd think this was Doom, Duke Nukem or something.

Anyway, if you liked HL/OpFor, you'll like this. It's more of the same! :-)

10/10
 
OniFire
523 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
41.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 février 2017
Half-Life Blue Shift:Análisis
Blue Shift es la segunda expansión oficial creada por Valve y Gearbox Software para Half-Life (1998), esta es la segunda de una trilogía de expansiones que ha hecho Gearbox para Valve para expandir más el universo de Half-Life en donde se estrenó a mediados del (2001) creado después de Opposing Force y siguiéndole el Decay el cual este último tristemente no llegó a Steam...Volviendo al tema, en Blue Shift está vez no seremos ni el bueno ni el malo si no alguien más neutral que digamos. Tomaremos el papel de Barney Calhoun el cual lo conocemos de mejor manera en Half-Life 2 y Half-Life 2 Episodio 1, el es un guardia de seguridad de rango medio en Black Mesa y el cual se encarga de la seguridad del Sector 3 de las instalaciones, mientras Barney hace lo de siempre ocurre el desastre del experimento de Xen donde Barney sin otra opción intentará escapar donde para poder lograr su objetivo, tendrá que buscar al tan mencionado Dr.Rosenberg quién Barney tendrá que ayudarlo si quiere escapar de Black Mesa sano y salvo, para eso tendremos que reparar un Portal para poder evacuar a parte del equipo científico que aún sigue vivo y a nosotros mismos claro...

Lo bueno:
Jugabilidad:La jugabilidad es lo mismo como en el juego original pero aceptemoslo y es que hoy en día se sigue disfrutando bastante la jugabilidad de los Half-Lifes de antes, me encanta que Blue Shift en su época tenga la misma magia del Half-Life y Opposing Force, el juego a pesar de no tener muchas innovaciones a parte de que solo cambian el Skin de Gordon por el brazo de Barney, se trata más de la inteligencia artificial y todo eso, Opposing Force es acción y suspenso ♥♥♥ desarrollo y Blue Shift se toma todo ♥♥♥ más calma y ♥♥♥ cosas básicas dando más a una combinación corta del 1 y ♥♥♥ esté. ✔

Gráficos:Es lo mismo pero en esta expansión se nota un poco las mejoras y pocos cambios, igual se sigue disfrutando aunque en esta ocasión no voy a decir que eran buenos para su época puesto que ya era (2001) y ya habían juegos ♥♥♥ grandes gráficos que puedo mencionarte pero aún si se sigue disfrutando. ✔

Interacciones y ambientación.Las interacciones fue una de las cosas que hizo famoso y un éxito a Half-Life, más allá de a veces tener algún que otro error es acá en Blue Shift donde lo llevan a otro nivel las interacciones, obviamente me refiero al personaje del Dr.Rosenberg que además de ser un nuevo personaje, en gran parte es que trae Interacciones buenísimas en donde vemos como Valve se tomó en serio a la hora de NPC así, otro punto es la ambientación, la mayoría de lugares en los que estamos tienen una ambientación excelente y creeme que en gran parte vas a estar más a solo a diferencia de la anterior expansión o Half-Life directamente. ✔

Referencias:Algo que me gusta mucho de estas expansiones son las referencias que hacen donde el jugador luego sabe a la perfección en que parte cronológica ocurre Half-Life y Blue Shift, tenemos desde Cameos de Gordon Freeman, G-Man hasta un cameo de Gina Cross que es una de las pibas del Decay como algunas referencias a Shepard sobre el quilombo del inicio de Opposing Force y entre otras referencias buenas, Blue Shift es el primero que comienza un poco antes que Half-Life, terminando el juego donde Gordon es atrapado por los militares. ✔

Lo malo:
Historia:Para empezar es una expansión que no tiene una gran historia pues es bastante simple la trama y corta, aunque Opposing Force era lo mismo pero la magia fue el desarrollo que tuvo, en Blue Shift no es una gran aventura como la de Shepard pues para empezar el desarrollo es simple y corto, en gran parte aburrido y básico en su mayoría, pudieron hacer algo mejor en esto en vez de solo sacar más provecho a Half-Life e agregando algunas pocas cosas nuevas o lo de la inteligencia artificial. ✖

Duración:El juego no va a durar ni el doble de lo que fue Opposing Force o el juego original, en una hora y medía lo terminas puesto que solo se trata de sobrevivir, buscar a Rosenberg, reparar el Portal y fin. Pudo ser mejor y eso que la expansión salio en el (2001), 1 año después de Opposing Force donde pudieron haberlo hecho un poco más largo o tener una duración pasable al menos. ✖

Sonidos y Soundtrack:Pues más allá de algún que otro nuevo audio y Soundtracks, todos los sonidos son los mismo y sin cambios o mejoras simplemente es todo igualito, la gran parte de músicas son de Opposing Force por lo que no hay muchos temas nuevos para Blue Shift... ✖

Innovación:Si algún nuevo escenario, Puzzles pero no innova nada, los mismos enemigos de siempre ♥♥♥ la excepción de que no aparecerán muchos y menos los de la raza X que vimos en Opposing Force, aparecen los básicos que la mayoría conocemos, tampoco esperes nuevas armas porque la mayoría son las mismas ♥♥♥ la excepción de que serán más pocas que antes, los sonidos son los mismos, los mismos personajes pero algo reducidos, mismos objetos, etc... ✖

Final:El final es demasiado simple, escapar y Ya? eso fue todo? más allá del cameo de Freeman y la cronología en la que sucede el final no termina de convencer
porque a pesar de que por fin escapamos en un personaje, es demasiado simplón en donde realmente esperaba más si les digo. Half-Life tenía un final más interesante y ♥♥♥ más ganas, lo mismo ♥♥♥ Opposing Force solo que ese es lo mismo y algo decepcionante pero mejor logrado y más ♥♥♥ el tema de los jefes como la intriga que dejaba. ✖

Escenarios y lugares:Si, tienen sus buenos diseños y ambientaciones pero aceptemoslo, los diseños son algo desperdiciados y la mayoría de veces se repiten puesto que solo hacemos algo y volvemos a ese mismo lugar, etc. No te confiés, tienen buenos diseños pero terminan siendo decepcionantes en los demás aspectos. ✖

No está en Español:Al igual que en Opposing Force se vuelve a repetir el mismo problema, se trata de que tampoco está doblado al Español o traducido algo que nosotros mismos tendremos que solucionarlo, en serio compras pero Steam te lo entrega digamos incompleto puesto que los demás idiomas lo pueden disfrutar pero nosotros nos tenemos que bancar o al menos de que busquemos cómo solucionarlo. ✖

No tiene multijugador:Blue Shift no tiene un modo multijugador como Half-Life o el Opposing Force, algo que puede ser bien o mal puesto que aceptemos que el juego no trae para nada armas nuevas, grandes mejoras, etc. ✖

Bugs:BUGS, BUGS, Y MAAAAAS BUUUUUGS. ✖

Conclusión:
Si venís como yo de jugar al Opposing Force no será una sorpresa que te quedes decepcionado jugando esta expansión...Blue Shift solo exprime más la fama de Half-Life en esa época, la verdad hay más mods de Half-Life que salieron en ese año y fueron mucho mejores que Blue Shift. Vale la pena comprarlo a 1 Dólar o menos por ahí a 15 o 20 pesos argentinos, preferible comprarlo más en Half-Life Collection o Valve Complete Pack ya que casi 4 dólares no vale la pena.
Barney es mi personaje favorito de la saga pero aceptemoslo su expansión deja mucho que desear y pudo dar para más...Pero porque entonces lo recomiendo? Porque es rejugable como casi todos los Half-Life, se disfruta a pesar de las pocas innovaciones ♥♥♥ unos Puzzles muy buenos, interacciones de lo mejor de esta expansión y bla bla bla.
En fin, Blue Shift es decepcionante pero disfrutable por si queres volver a jugar de nuevo la magnífica Saga de Valve

Puntaje final:
7/10
B
 
Blλke Cλlhoun
